Aspects are at the core of the Fate system, and are used also in Fate Of Heroes. Every character begins the game with at least three aspects, up to a maximum of five; they don’t need all to be filled in advance, but can be revealed during play

223654.name: Fate of Heroes: GMing Guide
223654.description:
From the introduction:

Mastering Fate Of Heroes requires you to stick to some principles and moves, also as the GM. You will notice that several of these resemble the principles and rules of Apocalypse World. They are provided both as guidelines to keep things interesting and on-track, and to inspire you with what keeps the action rolling.

223655.name: Fate of Heroes: The Hero
223655.description:
From the introduction:

As The Hero, you will be the focus of the first campaign of the game. If you keep playing past the first campaign, you might switch archetype or carry the game to the point where such archetype is no longer relevant.

User summary:

A character playbook.

223656.name: Fate of Heroes: The Wise
223656.description:
From the introduction:

As The Wise, you will be the one clarifying their purpose to the Hero, and supporting and guiding them in their fight against the Dark Threat. If you keep playing after the first campaign, you might tune your character to move forward, beyond the defeated Dark Threat.

User summary:

A character playbook.

223657.name: Fate of Heroes: The Guardian
223657.description:
From the introduction:

You are The Guardian: you will be the one watching over the Hero and the other characters; you will be their blade and shield and your strength and stern resolve will support them against the Dark Threat.

If you keep playing after the first campaign, you might tune your character to move forward, but for now, you’re going to be the Hero safe, with the steel of your blade.

User summary:

A character playbook.

223658.name: Fate of Heroes: The Rogue
223658.description:
From the introduction:

As The Rogue, you will be dragged into the adventure perhaps against your will, maybe forced by debts or troubles, or by a mysterious feeling that is pushing you to help the clueless hero. Perhaps the hero needs your protection against the stupid honesty of those like the wise or the guardian. Perhaps there will be something to gain, here.

User summary:

A character playbook.

223659.name: Fate of Heroes: The Ranger
223659.description:
From the introduction:

As The Ranger, you will be in charge of guiding the group in the wilderness and probably deep into the Wild. You will support them when far from the human cities or the Eternal City, and show them how vast your knowledge of the vast untamed land is. Without you, they’d be lost, even if the wise claims to know it all.

You, and only you, can show the path to the hero; darkness hides deep into the Wild and you’ve seen it.

User summary:

A character playbook.

223660.name: Fate of Heroes: Session Sheet
223660.description:
User summary:

This two-page document is intended to support the game master during session play. As a print-and-play document, it provides tracking for a variety of game data.

223661.name: Legenden om...
223661.description:
From the introduction:

In 1917 a British expedition uncovered several pieces of a stele during excavations in Iraq. The stele was transported to the British Museum where an ancient inscribed language was studied for decades. Eventually the archeologists and philologists deciphered four legends about Hyperborian heroes after the era of Atlantis.

User summary:

This scenario was first played at Viking-Con 27, in 2008. Is is distributed as two PDF files:


77-page scenario
4-page supporting maps

223662.name: Legenden om... II
223662.description:
From the introduction:

In 1903, Briton William James II led an expedition to Syria to excavate the mound of Tell Sabir Khirbet. He was inspired by Heinrich Schliemann's excavations of Troy in the 1870s, where Schliemann found 3,500 year old golden cats, and proved that a historic core was behind the myth. William James III dug four meters down and then uncovered layers of a ruined city.

After months of excavations the expedition reached found a truly ancient layer of ruis. That night, miners disappeared from the camp, and subsequently William James III never announced his findings. But his unpublished, secret notes have been passed down in his family. The tell of the founding of the royal family Mokai of Khorajah in the ninth century after the downfall of Atlantis.

User summary:

This scenario was first played at Viking-Con 28, in 2009. Is is distributed as three PDF files:


61-page scenario
1-page illustrated map
3-page supporting maps

223663.name: Legenden om... III
223663.description:
From the introduction:

One of the best-kept secrets in the archaeological collection at the National Museum is not the two golden goblets from Atlantis or the royal crown from Ascalon, but Melnibonéan Black Scriptures.

When exposed to the light of a full moon, a tiny script appears on the yellowed pages and tells tales of dark memories, of heroes, and skæbnebetvingere. Not only from the distant past, but also from other worlds... and other dimensions...

User summary:

This scenario was first played at Viking-Con 29, in 2010.

223664.name: Legenden om... IV
223664.description:
From the introduction:

Legenden om... is the fourth chapter in the series of Ascalon scenarios. The scenario consists of four short scenarios about four soldiers of fortune whose paths cross again and again.

User summary:

This scenario was first played at Viking-Con 30, in 2011.

223665.name: Legenden om... V
223665.description:
From the introduction:

In 1992 the Provincial Archives obtained the private papers of Anker Allcock Kroyer. The papers included written reports from his wife, who was a spiritualist. Several times she channeled the high priest Belophorus from Ascalon, an ancient city dating from after the downfall of Atlantis. Three of these terrible revelations were recorded in special detail...

User summary:

This scenario was first played at Viking-Con 31, in 2012.

223666.name: Setting Works: Near-Future Detective
223666.description:
From the introduction:

Even in the future there’s going to be crime. Shocking, right? As criminals grow more sophisticated, law enforcement has to adapt. Social pressures cause changes in operational policy. Today’s technological innovations are going to contribute greatly to the field of criminology. Keep reading to get a glimpse at tomorrow’s cops.

223667.name: Just Dance 2016
223667.description:
Just Dance 2016 is a dance video game developed and published by Ubisoft. Unveiled on June 15, 2015, during its E3 press conference, it was released in October 2015[2] for PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Wii, and Wii U.[3] A sequel, Just Dance 2017, was released on October 25, 2016.

2016 notably placed an emphasis on the use of a smartphone mobile app for motion detection, and introduced a subscription-based service which offers streaming access to a back catalogue of songs from previous entries in the franchise, as well as additional content that is exclusive to the service.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Just_Dance_2016 Just Dance 2016]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

223668.name: Ecchi Sketch: Draw Cute Girls Every Day!
223668.description:
User Summary

Visual novel, the story of Yume Akiyama, who works in a dead end job.

223669.description:
Early Glories: Rivoli – Zürich – Montebello – Marengo

Early Glories is the revised republication of the games Rivoli 1797 (VaeVictis #18), Zürich 1799 (VaeVictis #29), Montebello 1800 (Canons en Carton) and Marengo 1800 (VaeVictis #35).

The game includes totally new graphics (map and counters).

432 die-cut counters
4 maps
One player aid
One rules and scenario booklet
223669.name: Early Glories

223671.name: Isle of Domination: Tabletop Version
223671.description:
Isle of Domination is a turn-based Strategy-Economy Board Eurogame.

The game starts with random map creation. Several hexes build up the map in any shape. There are also resource-tokens placed on some hexes those add more randomness to the map.
Players can build cities, armies on game map.

Gameplay goes around resources. There are two types of resources:

Countable resources like food, wood, stone, ore, test-tube and gold.
Special resources like horse, iron, fish, wheat, marble, diamond and mana are used to develop (science) or build (building) something.




There is no storage for resources, a player needs to have access (by having a city near the resource) to certain number and type of resources to build something. Food is the most important resource, each city, extra population and army eats one food. You need food-surplus to build a city/army/extra population, but no problem if your food production goes under your food production (no starving to death).

Each player has an Economy Page (like character page in RPGs), that shows the state of his empire. Players use small markers for recording various things.

Player's turn have 4 phases:

Money Phase: Player adds the number of his/her gold production to treasury. (Gold is the only resource in Isle of Domination, that is storaged.)
Army Moving Phase: Players can move their armies by grid lines of hexes. Combat system is very simple: if attacker's army is stronger than defender army, defender army has to be withdrawn. No die rolling this time. Army power is based on sciences, and have modifiers by terrain, city or buildings.
Dismiss Phase: Player can dismiss any number of cities, armies and extra population to create the needed food-surplus to build something.
Building Phase: Player can build a City (on a hex edge occupied by an army), increase Population, build an Army, develop a Science and/or build a Building in this phase.




The goal of this game is to reach one of the six Victory Conditions. It is possible that all other Players have stronger economies, stronger armies and bigger empires, but still you win because you reach one of the Victory Conditions.
There are 6 different types of Victory:


Territory Victory: You dominate by having a large number of cities.
Military Victory: You dominate by having a very strong and large army.
Population Victory: You dominate by outnumbering others in population.
Science Victory: You dominate by knowledge. (You develop Future Science 2.)
Cultural Victory: You dominate by your people's cultural influence. (You build Cathedral.)
Magical Victory: You dominate by magical superiority. (You have a city near every Mana resource.)


Randomized map preparation may make some of the Victory types easier than others. But when several players pursuit the same victory, it will be much more difficult to achieve it.

223673.name: The B/X Warrior
223673.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explode the talents of your combat-oriented characters with this book!

More than simply a fighter, the warrior class has access to talents drawn from a wide range of archetypes, all integrated into a single class. Berserkers & swashbucklers, thugs & knights, paladins & rangers, gladiators & skalds. No need for all of those specialised sub-classes any more!

Within these pages, you will discover:

Complete advancement tables for level 1 to 20.
36 adventuring talents.
Themed packages of talents for a quick start into the game.
Rules for song magic and dabbling in arcance secrets.




Suitable for use with B/X, Labyrinth Lord, and other old-school adventure games.

223674.name: Zombie Tsunami
223674.description:
​Zombie Tsunami is a party game for 3 to 6 players that plays in under 30 minutes.

In the game, every player leads a horde of zombies storming the city. The winner is the one with the most zombies at the end of a 3 round game. But beware, humans are everywhere and they won’t let you win without a fight.

Players will have to collaborate, bluff, and sometimes betray one another in order to win the game!

223675.name: Project Airlock: Resurgence Expansion
223675.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Resurgence Expansion Pack for Project Airlock contains 18 new cards, including new characters and abilities, new missions, and powerful new additions to the deck such as Engine Failure and Nullify. It is shuffled into the Project Airlock game deck to add more variety and allow for more complex strategies.

223676.name: Madrasso
223676.description: Madrasso, also known as Mandrasso or Magrasso, is perhaps the most popular and widespread card game in Venice and the surrounding region, where it has over the last 50 years practically replaced the older game Scarabocion. In the ranking and values of cards and the presence of a trump suit it is related to Briscola, but because of the necessity to follow suit (as in Tressette) Madrasso offers greater scope for sophisticated card play technique.

223677.name: Neonitry Wars
223677.description:
User Summary

Based on Geometry Wars. You control a ship and fly around a 2D fixed field. However you do not shoot enemies. Instead you fly through gates to destroy them. But don't hit the orange tips of the gate or the enemies or you will die. R restarts the game, so don't press that if you want to keep playing. Use arrow keys or WASD to maneuver your ship.

223678.name: Slipstream
223678.description:
Slipstream is a compact card game for 2-4 players in which you take the role of scientists fighting your way through shifting dimensions to reach your control panel to return to your dimension. You are in a race across the 25 laboratory cards between you and your control panels. Each player gets a 'Slipstream Gun' card that allows them to warp themselves or others to different dimensions. Some dimensions contain cards that make the trip across the board easier, while other dimensions make the journey more perilous. Players must balance their urge to race across the board with their need to blast other players into neighboring dimensions. To win, a player must make it across the lab to their own control panel.

Each turn every player gets to perform one movement action and one 'Slipstream Gun' action. The movement action allows the players to move their token to a neighboring card, edging ever closer to their control panel, and victory. For their 'Slipstream Gun' action, players can choose to shoot any player (sending them to another dimension) or they can 'recalibrate' their gun by flipping the card over. This changes what dimension players will go to when shot with the 'Slipstream Gun'.

Players start at one end of a 4x5 card grid. Their control panels are on the opposite side. All of the laboratory cards are face down and as players move on to each card, it is flipped face up and the events on the face of the card are incurred. These can offer benefits like moving forward or gaining an item card. They can also be negative like losing a turn or being sent to the 'Dark World' a dimension in which the cards are much more challenging.

The game ends when any player is able to make it all the way across the board and steps on to the colored control panel that matches their player token.

223679.name: Five Paladins
223679.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a great NPC to give your game some thrills and fun, well Avalon is here with an other great pathfinder based product. Yep Avalon is happy to offer you five great NPCs. Each issue will come with a selection of five characters that you can introduce to your game. Need a villain, well we got them. Need a love interest or rival. Yep, they are there.

223680.name: Avalon Haunts 11
223680.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

223681.name: Avalon Hazards 03
223681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need to add a bit of a challenge to your games, well Avalon is here to help out. This series of hazard for the Pathfinder game system will offer your players a brief bit of fun and excitement, a challenge that they will have to face and overcome.

Bring your players to their knees and add some fun to your game with Avalon Hazards.

223683.name: No Mercy
223683.description:
Based on the card game "War", but with a twist. Take part in the epic battle between gun-toting kitties and power-hungry aliens.

If you have ever played the game of "War", then No Mercy will be instantly familiar. "No Mercy" follows the same game mechanics, in which each player turns over the top card of their deck, and the player with the highest card wins.

But there is a twist: the player with the lowest number has the option to pull the facedown card from the top of the modifier deck; modifiers can add or take away from your card's number, and can also be an action that has a positive or negative result on your hand.

As with war, the winner is the first person to lose all their cards, or, optionally, the player with the largest deck when a time limit is reached.

Each card contains an imaginative drawing by the children's book illustrator and comic artist Travis Hanson.

223684.name: Hunting for Gloomwing
223684.description:
From the introduction:

You are a proud member of the Clay Coyote Tribe, which roams the misty plains of Cloudsward. Recently, your tribe has fallen on hard times due to sudden scarcity of food. This has resulted in both hunger and illness claiming the lives of several tribemen, including Chieftain Oluga Trollbane.

In the absence of a chieftain, the elders of the tribe were tasked with coming up with a plan that could turn the tides. They decided that only by defeating Sovgrindlar – Gloomwing – had the tribe hope of surviving. The reason was two-folded: 1) Gloomwing was directly responsible for the sudden diminishing population of prey, and 2) selling dragon parts to the civilised world outside of Cloudsward would bring the tribe more than enough coin to pay food, medicine, and other useful resources to last the year.

223686.name: Virtual Rides 3
223686.description:
THE MOST EXTENSIVE FUNFAIR RIDE SIMULATION EVER!
Virtual Rides III is here! Set foot in an even bigger, more colorful, and more impressive fairground than ever before! Let your imagination be your guide! Design, control, and ride more than 10 unique attractions!

FEATURES
Customize

Virtual Rides III turns you into a showman! Whether you change the color of the components, the components themselves, or the decoration – it's all in your hands!
Use lighting, effect equipment, fog machines, and stroboscopes to perfectly stage your fairground attractions! Give your visitors a ride they'll never forget!
When night falls, the lighting system immerses the funfair in a very special light! From laser shows to color changes – everything is possible!


Control

You are the carnival barker! Grab a microphone and fire up your guests with your own calls!
The atmospheric lighting doesn't really come into effect until sunset – but that's no problem! Simply change the time and even the weather!
Take your place in the control booth and use the 3D panel to control the ride just as you like!


Ride

There are more than 10 attractions available! Start them up and give your guests the ride of their lives!
Now it's your turn! Climb in, buckle up, hold on tight – and ride your fairground ride!


30 acres of fairground full of breathtaking attractions and more than 100 stands whose offerings will make your mouth water. Enjoy your visit to the funfair and encounter huge crowds that react to their environment.

Source: The Publisher Website.

223687.name: Brace for Impact!
223687.description:
Description from the publisher:

Brace for Impact! is a 2-Player micro dice game that requires lightning-quick decisions, dexterity and stamina. As a Naval Submarine Commander your mission is to either gather enough vital intel or destroy your enemy’s crew before your enemy beats you to it. Each Commander controls two dice and a meeple crew aboard a submarine equipped with torpedoes. Surface and dive, load and fire torpedoes and manage your crew to become victorious. Do you have what it takes to win?

How to Play:

THE SETUP: Prepare for your epic battle by separating the black and blue game pieces. Each player receives two dice, 1 chit, 1 torpedo, and 3 Meeples of their color. The 8 intelligence gems and extra meeples are set off to the side within reach of both players.

Ready? START ROLLING! Engage your aquatic rival in a real-time, action-packed battle by rolling your dice. Manage to roll a 7 or doubles and you have a few options:

ON THE SURFACE: 7's on the surface allow you to dive underwater OR add 1 crew member. Doubles on the surface allow you to load your torpedo OR drop depth charges to remove 1 of your rival's gathered intelligence gems.

UNDERWATER: 7's underwater allow you to return to the surface OR gather 1 intelligence gem. Doubles underwater allow you to load your Torpedo OR fire your torpedo (if loaded) to remove 1 of your rival's crew members.

Play continues until a player loses their entire crew or gathers 5 intelligence gems!

223688.name: Hier kommt die Maus
223688.description:
Hier kommt die Maus is a simple die-rolling game for children that features the main character of a popular German children's TV program, "Die Sendung mit der Maus" (The Program with the Mouse), which first aired in 1971.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving accordingly. If they end up on a spot showing two arrows, they they have to move forwards or backwards according to the colour of the pips. Additionally, on two spots players can fall back. The first player to reach the last spot on the board – the tv studio – wins!

This game shares its designer with Mausefalle (1980) and re-implements it.

223689.name: Funfair Ride Simulator 3
223689.description:
HAVE YOU EVER OWNED A FUNFAIR RIDE?

Probably not … Now you can experience this on your smartphone or tablet with the new Funfair Ride Simulator 3. Now with even more realistic and better HD graphics, new features and a simulated fairground!

Control and marvel at some of the most breathtaking rides that can be found on the fairgrounds around the world. Watch how visitors buy tickets and seat in your ride. Choose your lighting and sound effects, or simply sit yourself in one of the gondolas and experience your very own ride! On day or at night – you decide!
FEATURES

• Control the most fascinating rides that can be found on the fairgrounds around the world
• Comprehensive simulated fairground
• Interacting people
• High quality graphics in HD
• Even more realistic physics
• Playable Jingles
• Share your ingame experience via Everyplay recodings
• Social Gaming: Archievements and leaderboards

Source: The Developer Website.

223690.name: La Pour'Suite Masquee
223690.description: The Masked Pursuit is a fast-paced card game for 2-4 people where all players play at the same time. Place your cards as fast as possible and before your opponents. The fastest wins!

223691.name: Run Gangs Out! Game
223691.description: Educational game in which players roll and move around the board. Each space has a stack of cards players read, gaining information about gang activities and how to fight them (and points). First player to 315 points (or circle the board 5 times) wins.

223692.name: Melody Monsters
223692.description:
- Connect 3 or more musical Monsters
- Unlock challenging levels
-Learn about musical genres and their secrets with the characters from Trivia Crack
- Musical effects worthy of the best orchestras
- Use Facebook to challenge your friends and share your results
- Earn fantastic prizes: coins, lives, and much more
- Colorful and fun graphics
- Play in over 20 languages

Source: The Game Website.

223693.name: Constantinople
223693.description:
Constantinople is a solitaire historical wargame covering the millennium-long history of the Byzantine empire, from the foundation of Constantinople in AD330 until its fall in AD1453. The player uses military might as well as diplomacy and outright bribery to keep the many opposing forces at bay for as long as possible. Can you outlive the historic Byzantine empire, or will your efforts be relegated to an obscure footnote in the history books?

Constantinople is not a highly detailed, historically accurate simulation of the history of the Byzantine Empire, but is historically based and gives a sense of the real situation of the Byzantine Empire throughout its existence, and provides some insights into the history surrounding Constantinople and the Byzantine Empire.

Source: The Developer Website.

223694.description:
On The Slopes is a fast-paced skiing adventure for 2-4 players. Each player is a skier or snowboarder racing around a mountain, trying to be the first to visit every lodge.

On The Slopes was one of five finalists in the 2016 Hasbro Game Design Challenge.

On your turn, you have three actions, which you can use to go up a lift, ski down a run, or pick up a stone from a lodge. But runs and lifts only work in one direction, you must carefully plan your route for the day.

Whenever you pick up a stone, you also get a Snow Card, which can give you benefits like extra action tokens or a one-time-only ability. Some Snow Cards let you help or hinder other players.

When going down runs, you can choose between easy green runs, intermediate blue runs, or advanced or expert black diamond runs. The more difficult runs are faster, but you might fall and have to take a Wipeout Card, which can cause bad things to happen.

Advanced players can play with special characters that give each player a unique ability they can use throughout the game.
223694.name: On The Slopes

223695.name: Bloop Reloaded
223695.description:
Bloop is back and it’s bigger and better than ever!

Your favourite chemistry potions puzzler is back in the all new Bloop Reloaded and ready to test the brain cells like never before! Make sure you save as much of the potions as possible. How you do it is up to you!

Source: The Publisher Website.

223696.name: Hex FRVR
223696.description:
User Summary

Fill in lines with various shapes of multiple hexagrams. When a line is full it disappears. Get points for disappearing more lines.

223697.name: Abort Retry Fail 20XX
223697.description:
Author's blurb:

It is the year 20XX. Despite the actions of the malfunctioning robots from the future the singularity has happened. It is now the first days of the war between humans and machines.

In the center of the war is one robot, it was unleashed with one mission then something went wrong and now it has several. This could be a good thing as there's no way it can fail them all... right?

User summary:

This item presents some variant rules to allow a competitive, three-player game without a game master. Although not authored by the game's creators, it did receive their sanction.

223698.name: Mystical Paths & Prestige Classes
223698.description:
From publisher blurb:

Witches and warlocks come in all shapes, sizes, genders, philosophies, alignments, and focuses. Many of these concepts are expressed through archetypes, but some concepts require a bit ... more ... to fully be expressed.

Here are 23 Prestige Classes for your witch or warlock, allowing them to focus on specific aspects of being a witch or warlock, or a specific type of witch or warlock with more control than an archetype gives you. With them, your witch isn’t "just" a witch, she’s a Tempestarii Storm Raiser, or he isn’t "merely" a witch, but an Occult Scholar.

Help find the true destiny of your witch or warlock!

223699.name: The Cabin: VR Escape the Room
223699.description:
The Cabin: VR Escape the Room will have you crawling through rafters as you search high and low for clues and objects that'll help you escape. Unravel the mystery of this lonely desolate cabin. You're stuck here, all alone - or are you?

Source: The Developer Website.

223700.name: Book of Shadows
223700.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legends say that witches keep their spells inscribed into a Book of Shadows that holds their accumulated wisdom and power.

Here, in Strange Brew: Book of Shadows, you’ll find magic drawn from real-world legends, mythology, and folktales, as well as pure flights of fancy. Within Strange Brew: Books of Shadows, you will find over 100 spells and a half-dozen rituals, enough to delight your characters, bedevil your foes, and make your witch (or other spellcaster, whether arcane or divine) a formidable opponent.

Witches are magical creatures.

223701.name: Beyond Fear
223701.description:
From the introduction:

In Beyond Fear, there are cosmic beings hidden away from society, alien races who are unfathomable by human imagination. They aren’t interested in us, unless they can use us for their gain, or if we happen to cross paths with them. It is safe to say that these entities are beyond us in terms of strength and power. Should you come across one then it’s wise to flee - that is, of course, if you haven’t already succumbed to madness at the mere sight of the thing. Players are not butch, rocket-launcher wielding marines in Beyond Fear. Rather, they are academics, journalists, lawyers, priests and detectives - ordinary people unraveling the frail tapestry of the universe strand by strand.

223702.name: AX:EL
223702.description:
Combining the very best of sci-fi and aerial dogfighting gameplay, AX:EL delivers a totally new gaming experience.

Create your very own shape-shifting vehicle and dominate both the sky and the ocean.

Build your own bespoke aircraft, from mainframe to wings. Dominate the skies then watch your aircraft morph in to a silent underwater killing machine as you chase the enemy from the blue skies in to the darkest depths of the ocean.

Source: The Developer Website.

223703.name: Think to Die
223703.description:
User Summary

Think To Die is a unique puzzle game where you have to find a way to die in order to pass the level. You have to master different situations, push blocks, combine objects, and time your movements in order to meet your demise.

223704.name: Think to Die 3
223704.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




User Summary

Think To Die 3 is the third installment of this unique puzzle series where you have to find a way to die in order to pass the level. You have to master different situations, push blocks, combine objects, and time your movements in order to meet your demise.

223705.name: Stapelspiele: Minimonster
223705.description:
Stack the monsters to form a giant pyramid! Who can match the dowels with the colors of the monsters and carefully slide them in between each figure without knocking them down?
5 quick games with varying rules and difficulty levels to provide engaging play and stacking fun for toddlers two and up. With entertaining options for older kids as well.
Each game varies slightly in its complexity which means as your child grows, you can advance to harder games or harder versions of the games you already know.
Contents include: 12 stacking monsters, 12 plugs, 1 stacking frame, 4 tiles, 1 die and set of instructions.

223706.name: The Days Before We Died
223706.description:
From the introduction:

Creating a sense of terror is nigh impossible in a tabletop setting. Classic tricks that work in other fiction, like jump scares or gory scenes, just don’t work and often things that are scary in movies, like invisible or undefeatable monsters are just annoying. Because your player’s are just playing characters you won’t be able to scare your player.

Instead, when running The Days Before We Died, try to achieve a sense of horror.

223707.name: Inept Sorcerers
223707.description:
From the introduction:

The Power is what sorcerers call the energy that makes magic happen. Every sorcerer can call on Power and shape it using their knowledge.

Unfortunately, you're inept. You might be a barely adequate apprentice struggling to win your master's respect. You might be a senile old coot who's forgotten most of his spells. You could even be an ordinary high school student, balancing your homework, your home life, and the study of an old grimoire you found with your friends. You're not exactly a master of magic.

223708.name: The Search for the Heir of Nolbeez
223708.description:
From the introduction:

The dragon Kilnmouth has sent his champion, Sir Mahgra Lastlife, to find and kill the last living heir of an ancient wizard. The PCs must find the heir and deliver help them escape from the dragon's reach. Little do they know, Mahgra Lastlife is already within their party!

User summary:

For 3rd - 4th level characters.

223709.name: Word Burp!
223709.description: Word Burp! is a faced paced word party game that rewards the fastest players each round. During each round 2 to 4 letters are randomly selected, one at a time, from a pool of letters. They are then placed, face up, in reverse order, within clear view of all players. Players are in a race to say a word that contains the letters in the order shown while meeting the requirements of that round (which are chosen randomly).

223710.name: Funfair Ride Simulator 3 - Ride Pack 1
223710.description:
User Summary

Adds the following three rides' simulations to Funfair Ride Simulator 3:

1) Galactic Race
2) Vodoo Swing
3) Flying Zeppelin

Experience the simulation gameplay of these rides in game.

223711.name: Funfair Ride Simulator 3 - Ride Pack 2
223711.description:
User Summary

Adds the following three rides' simulations to Funfair Ride Simulator 3:

1) Ghost Spin
2) Windmill
3) Rotorcraft

Experience the simulation gameplay of these rides in game.

223712.name: Funfair Ride Simulator 3 - Ride Pack 3
223712.description:
User Summary

Adds the following three rides' simulations to Funfair Ride Simulator 3:

1) Tiki Jump
2) Meteor
3) Mixer

Experience the simulation gameplay of these rides in game.

223713.name: Club Manager 2017
223713.description:
​In Club Manager 2017 you take on the role of an ambitious football manager.
Start with a team in the 8th division or take over an existing team in a higher division and lead your team to success.
Club Manager returns to the virtues of the classic football manager with an eye on the essentials.

Source: The Game Website.

223714.name: Tokaido
223714.description:
User Summary

Digital port of the popular board game.

223715.name: Ticket to Earth
223715.description:
A distant planet. A dying colony. A deadly conspiracy.

The mining boom has left New Providence to die, and just one Earthbound ship remains. Survivor Rose stands in defiance of a broken system. Rise up with fast-paced RPG tactics, and battle across vibrant fields of color.

Join the fight in Ticket to Earth, a sci-fi tale of betrayal and insurrection.

– Selected for Made With Unity Showcase at Unite Melbourne 2016
– Selected for PAX Rising at PAX East 2017

“It’s always a magical experience when a game comes together and hooks you in, which is exactly what Ticket to Earth did for me.” – Jakob Quilligan – checkpointgaming.net

FEATURES:

ORIGINAL GENRE MASH-UP
Introducing a new style of gameplay that blends puzzle and tactics games. Ticket to Earth is the quick-play, mission-based RPG you’ve been waiting for.

SCI-FI EPISODIC NARRATIVE
Join Rose, Wolf, Doc and Seven as they race across New Providence to stop a criminal conspiracy.

FIGHT FOR JUSTICE
Play as Melee and Ranged Peace Keepers, armed with over one hundred Combat Powers. Fight against a cabal of twisted enemies – desperate criminals, murderous machines and terrifying mutants.

JOIN THE MOVEMENT
The Stellar Consciousness Movement will help you reach your true human potential. Deep RPG character progression – develop your talents and build better heroes!

Source: The Developer Website.

223716.name: Spell Block Academy
223716.description:
Greetings, young Wizard!

Thank you for enrolling in Spell Block Academy – the pre-eminent school of spellcraft and wizardy!

Do you have what it takes to claim the staff of the Ultra-Magus! Enter the SpellBlock Vortex and begin your training.

Spell Block Academy is a irreverent, magical-themed spelling/puzzle game. The gameplay is focused on the recognition and spelling of high-frequency sight words. The game dictionary and challenge level can be configured for any primary school year level, allowing the game to assist a broad range of students.

Spell-Block Academy is a primary-level spelling game tailored to meet the needs of the Australian Curriculum.

Source: The Developer Website.

223717.name: Gobbling Goblins
223717.description:
Welcome to “The Rotten Toadstool”, the craziest restaurant in Goblin Town!

Maitre d’Grundle is in a panic! The Gobbling Goblins, three fierce food critics, have arrived and they’re determined to put your kitchen to the test! Your goal is to keep the food coming for these ghastly gourmets. Use your maths skills to create fearsome feasts for the fussiest foodies! Prove your numeric knowledge, beat the clock and maybe win the coveted Golden Goblin award.

Gobbling Goblins is primary-level maths education game which we created for ABC Splash.

Source: The Developer Website.

223718.name: Q.E.D: Cosmo's Casebook
223718.description:
QED: Cosmo’s Casebook is a mystery-adventure game set in Ancient Rome, during the final decades of the Roman Republic. You play as Cosmo Veritas, a hot-shot lawyer with a heart of gold, seeking fame and fortune in the Roman law courts. Cosmo, and his feathered sidekick Aquila, champion the rights of the downtrodden, taking on the cases that no other Roman lawyer would touch.

Part-gumshoe mystery, part-courtroom drama: QED: Cosmo’s Casebook presents three exciting cases which take you from the glittering heights to the stinky depths of Roman society. Have you got what it takes to lay down the Lore?

QED: Cosmo’s Casebook is an original history game for designed for late primary and secondary students.

Source: The Developer Website.

223719.name: Moshi Monsters:  Moshling Zoo
223719.description:
http://moshimonsters.wikia.com/wiki/Moshi_Monsters:_Moshling_Zoo_(video_game)

Moshi Monsters: Moshling Zoo is the first of three Moshi Monsters DS game made by Activision and Mind Candy. It was released in America and Canada on November 6th 2011 and later released in the United Kingdom on November 11th.

The objective of the game is to build a successful Moshling Zoo and please Moshlings in order to get them to join the Zoo. The player can also hatch found Baby Moshling eggs and compete their found Moshlings in races in order to get trophies to store in their trophy cabinet.

223720.name: Katsuma Unleashed
223720.description:
http://moshimonsters.wikia.com/wiki/Katsuma_Unleashed

Katsuma Unleashed is a side-scrolling, action-adventure platform game rendered in a beautiful 3D cartoon style and designed to appeal to Moshi fans of all ages across the globe. In a move away from the previous two titles, the game will feature stand-alone hero character Katsuma.

As the franchise’s most popular Moshi Monster, players will embark on a voyage with Katsuma through brand new worlds packed with mini arcade challenges and boss battles.

Along the way, Katsuma will have to battle enemy characters using powerful new capabilities, including Furi’s Smash and Diavlo’s Flight, in order to rescue other Moshi Monsters.

223721.name: Moshi Monsters: Moshlings Theme Park
223721.description:
http://moshimonsters.wikia.com/wiki/Moshi_Monsters:_Moshlings_Theme_Park_(video_game)

Moshi Monsters: Moshlings Theme Park (DS Game) is a Nintendo 3DS/ DS game made by Activision and Mind Candy released October 26th 2012.

The objective of the game is to rebuild the theme park and to find up to 60 Moshlings found around the park.

The game comes with a unique Furnando code which can only be used once.

223722.name: Moshi Monsters Egg Hunt
223722.description:
Moshi Monsters is back, and this time it’s all about catching and hatching Moshling eggs! Who’s in the egg? Only YOU can find out!

With help from Buster Bumblechops, hatch a new Moshling every day. You can then feed and play with them in your very own Moshling Treehouse! Can you collect them all?

Make your egg hunt even more monsterific with the amazing Moshi Monsters Egg Hunt book. This goopendous adventure is crammed with hidden codes and stars a totally unique, specially created Moshling named after YOU!

223723.name: Moshi Monsters Village
223723.description:
User Summary

Build your own Moshi Monsters village in 3D.

223724.name: Moshi Karts
223724.description:
User Summary

Kart racing game based in the Moshi Monsters universe.

223725.name: Moshi Monsters:  School of ROX
223725.description:
http://moshimonsters.wikia.com/wiki/Moshi_Monsters:_School_of_ROX

Moshi Monsters: School of ROX is a game developed for LeapFrog devices, designed to teach kids about mathematics. In the game, you solve basic math problems to help the monsters perform a concert, unlock Moshlings and music videos. The game is designed for 5-8 year olds, is published by LeapFrog, and is available on the LeapFrog App Centre

223726.name: Destination X
223726.description:
Description from the publisher:

Destination X is a game of one-against-many: One player takes the moderator role as a spy on the run, while the remaining players are detectives who must cooperate and use their deductive skills and geographical knowledge to track down the spy and identify their secret destination.

At the beginning of each round, six destination cards are placed face up on the table. The spy secretly chooses one of the destinations, and flips to the chosen country's page in the handbook. Each detective is given three informant cards, and in turn each detective must play an informant to get information about the spy's secret destination. The spy must find the relevant information in the handbook and answer truthfully. The informants may provide information on various aspects such as population, industry, religion, history, economy, and so on. After a detective has played an informant, the detective must also eliminate one of the destinations on the table.

At any time, the detectives can decide to guess on the spy's destination. If they guess correctly, the detectives win the round; otherwise the spy wins. The spy also wins if the detectives run out of informant cards, so the detectives must manage their resources well and not spend too much time or else the spy will manage to get away. The first side to win three rounds wins the game.

No prior geographic knowledge is needed to play, but having some insight might still help you in deducing the spy's destination. Since Destination X is a team-based game, it can be played in groups of any number of players.

223727.name: Visionary's Perch (5E)
223727.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5e Compatible GM's Resource by Jacob W. Russell

Far from the nearest shore, an ancient tower rises from the cold sea. Visitors who brave storm-lashed and pirate-filled waters to reach this remote island can gain a glimpse into the future or answers to their questions…for a price. The ancient cyclops seeress who dwells here, still watched over by the elves who conquered her people, requires a tribute from the penitents seeking her visions. Such prices may be designed simply to help fill the tedium of centuries in her gilded cage, or may in fact be a piece of a plan to rebuild her ancient empire; in any regard, they are non-negotiable.

223728.name: Visionary's Perch (Pathfinder)
223728.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM's Resource by Jacob W. Michaels

Far from the nearest shore, an ancient tower rises from the cold sea. Visitors who brave storm-lashed and pirate-filled waters to reach this remote island can gain a glimpse into the future or answers to their questions…for a price. The ancient cyclops seeress who dwells here, still watched over by the elves who conquered her people, requires a tribute from the penitents seeking her visions. Such prices may be designed simply to help fill the tedium of centuries in her gilded cage, or may in fact be a piece of a plan to rebuild her ancient empire; in any regard, they are non-negotiable.

223729.name: Visionary's Perch (System Neutral Edition)
223729.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM's Resource

Far from the nearest shore, an ancient tower rises from the cold sea. Visitors who brave storm-lashed and pirate-filled waters to reach this remote island can gain a glimpse into the future or answers to their questions…for a price. The ancient cyclops seeress who dwells here, still watched over by the elves who conquered her people, requires a tribute from the penitents seeking her visions. Such prices may be designed simply to help fill the tedium of centuries in her gilded cage, or may in fact be a piece of a plan to rebuild her ancient empire; in any regard, they are non-negotiable.

223730.name: The Marshal - A New Hybrid Class
223730.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #112 introduces the marshal, a hybrid class of the gunslinger and paladin whose faith allows him to go forth and bring the law to the lawless through the strength of his will and trusted gun.

223731.name: Bestow Curse
223731.description:
From publisher blurb:

For many a seasoned adventurer and explorer, magic can become, whilst still a useful tool, boring. You know what a certain spell is effective for, or how potent you need to be to use the spell found on a scroll.

The Spell Options series is a way of tweaking existing spells without using feats. You can change the colour, make the spell weaker and thus easier to cast or make them more powerful but unstable.

This volume focuses on what could be one of the more feared, effective and some would say evil spells – Bestow Curse.

223732.name: The Witch for the Hero's Journey RPG
223732.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double, Double, Toil and Trouble,

Fire Burn and Cauldron Bubble!

New material for your Hero's Journey RPG. This book includes:

New Race: The Gnome
New Professions
The Witch class and Hedge Witch tradition
80 spells new to The Hero's Journey
15 new monsters




Is your witch ready for her own heroic journey?
Now she can be!

223733.name: Song of the Woad
223733.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lands in Shadow for Shadow of the Demon Lord!

If you were to ask the scholars of Rûl to discuss the origins of the Woad, they would likely speak to you about "simple, savage, debased tribes descended from the First People," and perhaps they would venture forth that they are "common in descent from the beastmen," and "little different than those corrupted creatures."

But these academic musings would be sadly misguided at best: while they might share some archaic and nomadic customs with the first tribes of mankind, and are rightly characterized by their bestial nature, the Woad came to the lands much later than either humans or beastmen, and from a place no scholarly mind could ever grasp.

Propelled across the Void to Urth by the last gasping scream of a genie succumbing to madness, the Woad came from a world destroyed and forgotten long ago. They are a people who struggle to maintain their ancient customs and beliefs in a world that was initially alien to them upon their arrival, and has been hostile to them ever since.

Song of the Woad explores the various tribes of the Woad, a largely independent and wild folk who have long resisted efforts to be either absorbed or destroyed by the many great civilizations that have risen and fallen in Rûl in the centuries since their arrival on Urth. The Woad's steadfast refusal to be assimilated has resulted in a general view of them by most peoples of Rûl as hopelessly backward, beastly, and barbaric.

However, a closer look reveals that there is far more to the wild folk than one might expect, as you will discover in this addition to the Lands in Shadow series.

223734.description:
Nighttime is quickly approaching, and it's time to get the animals tucked into the barn. But what's going on? The animals keep running away. Are the other players causing this? A good memory and some luck with the die will help you in this crazy corralling game. The player who manages to corral all five of their animals into the barn first wins the game.

Freche Farm requires a good memory. While playing the game players should try to remember where the other players' animals are as this becomes important during the game!
223734.name: Freche Farm

223735.name: Lines
223735.description:
Lines is an abstract ‘zen’ game experience where form is just as important as function. Place or remove Dots to initiate a colourful race that fills a drawing. The colour that dominates the race wins. Lines is the perfect game to play while commuting or in other short moments of downtime. Play a single session in a matter of seconds or find yourself making a winning streak of 20 games in a row!

Source: The Developer Website.

223736.name: Sprawl
223736.description:
Sprawl is a tile-based puzzle game where players create their own sprawling towns. Plan your towns’ layout and solve pleasant puzzles by connecting plots and parcels to Sprawl across the map! Six combinations need to be connected. Connect grass with cows to create pastures, water with boats to create lakes, use roads, railway and trees to create villages, industrial zones, parks and much more! Watch your own little world come to life: Plan, connect and SPRAWL!

Features

Plan ahead to create beautiful sprawling towns.
Connect 12 resources to create 6 different plots and parcels.
Villages, lakes, industry, pastures, forests and mountain ranges.
Pleasant puzzles for all ages.

Source: The Developer Website.

223737.name: Briquid Mini
223737.description:
Briquid Mini is the cute little brother of tablet puzzler Briquid. It offers the same challenging gameplay, but in a smaller grid with upgraded graphics. Replay some of Briquids most dazzling levels in a Briquid Mini redesign and face dozens of new levels Mini has to offer! The whole game is newly built up and specially designed for smartphones. Build. Break. Solve!

History

The original Briquid was released as a tablet game in februari 2013. It received very positive reviews from game critics and game websites and was nominated for Best Mobile Game in the 2013 edition of the Dutch Game Awards. The game couldn't be ported to smartphones, because the grid would become to small. The game was completely redesigned for smartphones and with loads of new levels and a brand new look.

Features

Loads of bricks to build and smash.
Over 100 reservoirs to fill with 100% water.
Simple, pure gameplay with an upgraded retro look and feel.
Gravity direction changes that will turn your puzzle world view upside down.

Source: The Developer Website.

223738.name: Turnbased Templars
223738.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




Turnbased Templars is a 'realtime turn-based' strategy game. Fight in one-on-one battles to see who can conquer the most terrain on the map. Build walls and soldiers to capture more land than your opponent and beat your enemy.

The game is currently still in development, but you can play the game already. Note that the game is meant to play on mobile devices, playing multiple battles against various opponents.

Source: The Developer Website.

223739.name: Team Racing League
223739.description:
User Summary






UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




Team Racing League is the first team-based racing game where you win and lose together as a team. Compete in an online 3v3 race where skill and collaboration are key to victory. Team up, strategize and use tactics to disrupt and beat the opposing team in a MOBA-like clash!

History

Team Racing League has been in development for over a year. The game is inspired by retro arcade racing games like Super Off Road, Micro Machines and Championship Sprint. Instead of relying on power-ups, Team Racing League is all about teamwork and racing skills. It aims to be a pure racer, without artificial equalizing mechanics. During the game the complete track and all racers are visible in a top-down view, so that players have a clear overview to form team strategies. The mid-poly atmosphere is enhanced by an 80's style synthesizer soundtrack and palpable sound effects. Team Racing League is currently heading towards Steam Early Access.

Features

Team-based 3v3 racing
Win together, lose together
Support your teammates and block your opponents
Unique connecting mechanics
Skill-based racing
No power-ups or weapons
Practice against your own ghost

223740.description:
Bargain Quest is a game of adventure and capitalism for 2-4 players. Players will take the role of shopkeepers in an adventuring town plagued by monsters. Players must draft items and then secretly choose which items to place in their windows to attract wealthy heroes to their shops.

Once all heroes have been equipped, they battle against monstrous threats, earning money and adding prestige to whichever item shop they most recently visited. Throughout the game players will encounter new heroes and monsters while upgrading their shops and hiring employees. Once the third monster is defeated the player who has earned the most gold and prestige is the winner.
223740.name: Bargain Quest

223741.name: Lyndanise 1219
223741.description:
This battle shows the Estonians fighting the Danish in 1219 on the northern shores of Estonia.

Ownership of a game from A la Charge! series is needed to play this scenario.

The scenario includes 1 new map & 30 new counters.

223742.name: Color Brain
223742.description: Each turn a player draws a card that shows a word. The active player also chooses a color-card from his hand that shows the color best matching the word. The other players also choose a color-card from their hands. Answer correctly and your pawn moves closer to the finish.

223743.name: An Unfortunate, Sensuous Sonnet
rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player
223743.description:
From the introduction:

You are corresponding with Lady Delia Starling, a lady-in-waiting to a high-ranking noblewoman. She is a well-known flirt and was once engaged to a minor lordling who died of a mysterious ailment.

223744.name: Bane of the Bone Wizard
rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player
223744.description:
From the introduction:

You are writing to Osseous Scrag, wizard advisor to King Llacheu of Mochyn. Although he appears to be in his mid-60s, he is actually over 175 years old. It is said he has the ability to cast spells that can warp bone and mould flesh, and many in the king’s court fear his influence. He is an incorrigible miser.

223745.description:
Learn it in 60 seconds, play it everywhere! A thematic and portable pure strategy game.

Enter the futuristic universe of Antagonism through 4 distinct scenarios where only the finest strategists will survive.
In competitive or semi-cooperative mode, dominate or destroy your opponents!

The game is portable and magnetic, easy, fast and different every time.

Game overview
• Players choose one of the 4 scenarios and a group of 15 custom pawns with the same symbol and place them on the corresponding colours. Each scenario is grid-based with a different theme and objectives.
• Victory conditions: The main objective depending on the scenarios is to hold the Base(s) for 3(2) turns or Kill the enemy Leader(s). A King of the Hill variant for 3 players is available on a scenario.
• At every turn you can move up to 5 different pawns, one of which should always be the Leader (Black pawn). Pawns can move up to 2 spaces in any direction; Red pawns can move up to 3 spaces in any direction. Blue Pawns can move through clouds without penalty and use the Warps.
• Pawns of the same color can stack up to 3. This increases the strike force value and defence value. Pawns can detach and move on their own from a stack. The bottom pawn acts as a carrier.
• Every single pawn has a strike force Level 1 (L1). The Black pawn (the Leader) has a strike force L3 but his defence remains at L1.
•To attack an opponent pawn you must move your pawn onto a square occupied by the antagonist. By attacking an opponent pawn with a superior Level, you execute a suicide-attack; your pawn(s) is(are) sacrificed and the same number of antagonist pawns are eliminated.
223745.name: Antagonism

223746.name: I Know
223746.description: Trivia game: players take turn drawing a card and reading the category outloud. The other players now in turnorder must guess how many clues they will need before they can guess the correct answer. The lesser clues needed, the higher the points gained.

223747.name: Hot Cross Bunnies
223747.description: The goal of the game is to move your pawn to the finish while moving across a grid reaching numbers on Easter-egg-tiles from 1-24 in the right order. In your turn you roll two dice and move forward if you can. Bunnies are sometimes in your way and by spending coins you can move quicker. Make sure you reach the finish the first and you will win.

223748.name: Convocation of Death
223748.description:
User summary:

This scenario formally is untitled but Convocation of Death has been suggested by Matthew W. Schmeer, and the scenario has enjoyed wide circulation with that title.

It is a home-made scenario consisting of:


A one-page hand-drawn map
Four pages of typewritten keyed encounters
Five pages of handwritten keyed encounters


Probably, it is intended for characters of about 5th level. The scenario was created in 1981 and published as a PDF in 2012.

223749.name: The Golden Scepter of the Trollfens
rpgpublisher: The Play Generated Map & Document Archive
223749.description:
From the introduction:

This is a ready-made scenario including maps and all descriptions needed to play a basic game of Dungeons and Dragons with a minimum of preparations. Everything is right here and ready for you to play.
...
You are sent to find the magical golden scepter in the Troll Fens. The Kingdom of Kala where you live needs the scepter because of its great powers at causing orcs to do your will.

User summary:

This fan-created scenario was written abt. 1981 and received wide internet circulation from abt. 2015 on. It is encountered as a PDF and also as a collection of JPG scans and is hosted on a variety of file sites. The version enumerated here was created as a PDF in 2012 and includes a variety of page sizes, most somewhere in the neighborhood of US Letter.

223750.description:
Hardback is a deck-building word game, a prequel to Paperback. Players build a deck of letters with various powers and race to 60 fame points to win. Some of the features:


No wilds in your deck - any card can be wild.
Push your luck for more cards with the Ink system.
Match genre colors to gain bonus abilities on your cards.
Fight over the coveted Endorsement cards.
New Persistent cards stay in play, until someone uses them!
223750.name: Hardback
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 43 - Playing Campaign Games with Two

223751.name: The Catacombs of He Who Never Sleeps
rpgpublisher: The Play Generated Map & Document Archive
223751.description:
From the introduction:

[The] entrance is made of tough granite and was once decorated with elegant carvings and lettering. Now, however, it is in absolute ruin, choked with rubble from the raid. It is evidently impenetrable, and no amount of searching or digging will reveal any way to gain entrance.

User summary:

This fan-created, hand-written scenario is intended for low-level characters and was written as an expansion to B2: The Keep on the Borderlands. An overland hex map locates several areas from both scenarios. Written abt. 1982, the scenario has enjoyed with circulation since abt. 2015 as both a collection of JPG images and compiled PDFs.

223752.name: Mini Module M1: The Maze of Death
rpgpublisher: The Play Generated Map & Document Archive
223752.description:
User summary:

This "mini module" is a fan-created, hand-written scenario. It was created in 1981 and published as a PDF in 2012. Several versions have enjoyed wide circulation since abt. 2015 as either collected JPG files or PDFs with various formats.

It is intended for a single player character of low level with an estimated play time of 90 minutes.

223753.name: Mini Module M2: The Priest of Evil
rpgpublisher: The Play Generated Map & Document Archive
223753.description:
User summary:

This "mini module" is a fan-created, hand-written scenario. It was created in 1981 and published as a PDF in 2012. Several versions have enjoyed wide circulation since abt. 2015 as either collected JPG files or PDFs with various formats.

It is intended for a single player character of low level with an estimated play time of two hours.

223754.name: The Undying Heart of Merrik
223754.description:
From the introduction:

Recently there has been an uneasy feeling in the small coastal town of Chanler. Strange things have been happening in the middle of the night. People go missing for weeks and then return with no memory of where they have been. Others never return. The mayor has looked the other way, but not today. For his daughter has been missing for days, now! You and your brave companions must find her before it's too late!

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters.

223755.name: Empty Lies
223755.description:
From the introduction:

The tiny village of Walnut Hill's stream has run dry and it is harvest time. With no fresh water from the mill, cattle or the villagers, will you and your party be able to save the day?

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

223756.name: Spitting Image
223756.description:
From the introduction:

You and your group have just been called to the village of Walthain along the Nyr Dyv for a job. Great wealth was promised and your "expertise" is needed. Will you and your group be up to the task?

User summary:

For 3rd - 4th level characters.

223757.name: Adventure Interludes
223757.description:
From the introduction:

This book contains eight quick adventures for characters that range from levels 1st - 10th. Each adventure builds on the one before, but all can be [used as] stand-alone missions.

223758.name: PrettyPro Game
223758.description:
A little blush, some lip color, and eyeshadow can perk up even an exhausted look and fill the wearer with confidence and social energy. Yet, makeup can be a complicated thing. Youtube is filled with Internet celebrities who give expert advice, magazines roll out new style guides practically monthly, and everyone has a different face, meaning something that works for one person might not work so well for the next. To give younger girls an introduction to makeup, as well as a few deeper lessons about true beauty, Decker Sisters presents Pretty Pro: The Exciting Makeover Race Game.

To play, each player picks a character from the four playing pieces: Lauren, Izzy, Lexie, and Zoe. These characters come with profile cards that give a little background to them. These do not have any affect on the gameplay; they just allow players to get a little more into the game by picking their favorites. Each has a favorite color, pet, and hobby. They also give tips, both in fashion (“accessorize with scarves”), beauty (“always wear sunscreen when outside”), and internal beauty, described as a PrettyHeart quality (“always have a positive attitude”).

Pretty Pro is a straightforward game suitable for younger players. On a turn, a player rolls the dice and moves her or his character to a new square on the board. The goal is to land on each square necessary for the six components of a makeover: Lipstick, Blush, Eyeshadow, Brows, Earrings, and the PrettyHeart Tiara, which denotes inner beauty. The board also features stylish cities, where players draw cards. Some are good, such as “You are always kind with your words and never say anything hurtful. Find the PrettyHeart Tiara.” Others are not so good, “You went to bed very late last night. Now you feel grouchy and look tired. Lose your next turn.”

Facemask card. Players might be unlucky in landing on a Beauty Block square and missing out on something they need or gain the Facemask, which stops players from adding any new makeup. When a player lands on Beauty Block, she or he may move it to a new space, potentially keeping another player from getting the final square needed to win.

Perhaps the best part of Pretty Pro is the coloring sheets. The set comes with colored pencils and a pad for each character, and extras may be printed off the website. Through the game, whenever a player lands on a space she needs, the player may color in the makeup on the character’s face. This is a great introduction into style, seeing what colors work, what is not enough, and what might be too much.

Pretty Pro is a game for two to four players aged six and up. It is a moderately long game, taking twenty to thirty minutes to play, depending on how quick and lucky the players are. With its randomized dice-rolling play and fun coloring sheets, younger players will enjoy it the most as they eagerly assemble the parts of their makeovers.

Which make-up artist will win the game? Players use strategy, skill and luck as they race their friends to create the perfect look, but soon learn that inner beauty is needed before any makeover is complete. Game cards reward kindness and cover fun topics including beauty and fashion tips. Hurry to be the first to capture the PrettyHeart Tiara and finish the face to win this exciting makeover race!
Ages 6+, 2-4 players, 15-20 minute play time, reading not required to play.
Contents: Game board, 52 card deck, coloring pencils, facemask, beauty block, PrettyHeart Tiara, set of 4 make-up sketch pads, set of fun info cards, character playing pieces, stands, dice, instructions.

223759.name: Unwritten: That Which Happened
223759.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development.




User Summary


Delve into a turn based strategy game with meaningful, permanent decisions
Play as successive generations of a nomadic clan, passing stories and legends down through the ages
Experience infinite novelty through randomly generated maps, units, abilities, and enemies
Make decisions that become a part of your personal "story", affecting your ability to barter and ally with rival clans
Make the trek to "God Mountain", a place of final judgement and potential glory
Experience a rich, exotic world inspired by international traditions of story-telling
Make your own game modules using the same tools the developer used to make the game


The Story:

The People, who name themselves after their leader, have their eyes on the mountain across the tundra.

223760.name: Three Clerical Items of Renown
223760.description:
User summary:

Includes three substantive magic items geared toward cleric type characters: Wig of Wigging, Ashes of the Martyrs, and Trivel of Power. Suitable for use with any "old school" type system.

223761.name: Asteroids
223761.description: Asteroids is a board game adaptation of the Atari video game from the 1980s.

223762.name: Missile Command
223762.description: Missile Command is a board game adaptation of the Atari video game from the 1980s.

223763.name: Centipede
223763.description: Centipede is a board game adaptation of the Atari video game from the 1980s.

223764.name: You've Been Schooled
223764.description:
A Stop, Drop, & Roll Adventure Seed Dice Table

From the introduction:

The [player characters] have stumbled into a schoolroom in the middle of the dungeon. The teacher is having a bit of trouble with the students. Can the [characters] give Mrs. Winterwitch a hand?

223765.name: 0-Level Characters: A Guide
223765.description:
From the introduction:

This article describes how to run a 0-level adventuring party in Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition), which makes it much more akin to Hârn. A 0-level adventure follows this discussion.

223766.name: 72 Zero-Level Pre-generated Characters Suitable for Old School Flavored RPGs
223766.description:
User summary:

Presents names, statistics blocks, and concise notes for each non-player character. Characters are presented four to a page and are suitable for print-and-play use.

223767.name: Galactic Warlords: Battle for Dominion
223767.description:
After the fall of the once powerful Preiakka Federation, the region was thrown into conflict and chaos. Wars that were fought between the member worlds have weakened their power, and the Warlords, together with other outside factions as their sponsors sensed it was a good time to strike and attempt to establish their dominion over the fragmented region of space.

Galactic Warlords: Battle for Dominion is a card-driven game of tactical deployment and planet control. In this game, you play as one of the Warlords, with purpose to establish your dominion over the contested galactic region and score the most points at the end of the game. You will do this by playing your hired Mercenary cards from your hand in your tableau. Each of the Mercenaries will come with their own assets such as Ground Troops or Defense Systems, and abilities (actions) such as Deploy Ground Troops, Recon, Assassinate and many others. By using these assets and abilities, you will be able to assert control over the planets in contested galactic region. At the end of the game, you will score points for completing Missions of the Mercenaries you have played during the game as well as other bonus points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the Great Warlord and winner of the game!

223768.name: Sinister Six-Pack Volume One
223768.description:
From publisher blurb:

Surprise even the most veteran players with these fully-realized new monsters. Each has unique powers and exclusive illustrations. Built in strict adherence to the D&D 3.5e rules set.

Each monster entry has its own art and is structured just as it would be in the Monster Manual.

Any of these critters will leave you players with something new to talk about for years to come.

Monsters in this volume:

The Gristlygnash - A hulking bear-shark zombie.
The Half-Red Dragon Beholder - The fusion of a red dragon and a beholder.
The Half-Green Dragon Displacer Beast - A cunning predator with a green dragon's deadly powers.
The Imaginary Friend - The embodiment of a sorcerous child's imagination, either protective or vengeful.
The Pythean - A secretive race of psychic reptilian centaurs, who concoct their plans in the shadows.
The Void Strutter - A lethal construct built around an Orb of Annihilation.

223769.name: Clean Up Your Room!
223769.description: Clean Up Your Room! is a family friendly card game with a simple goal: score the most points while trying to get all of the objects off your room floor. On each player's turn, she can put an object, such as power tools or a pink fairy armadillo, one of her pieces of furniture. She might also steal an object from a sibling's room floor. Or, she might throw something from her room into another room. Players can also use event cards to mix things up, but sometimes they have unexpected consequences like making animals run from room to room! When one player's room floor is clear of objects, the game ends. All players count up points for objects put away plus any bonus points and subtract one point for any objects left on their room floors.

223770.description:
Description from the publisher:

There are six companies that will change the world as we know it! You can be part of their success and be a investor. Try to become rich by making the right decisions!

Only the one biggest investor can get money out of each company. You must try to read the next steps of your rivals and use your capital and your three hidden cards to win against them and become the biggest shareholder!

You have to be lucky in this game but you must also think about your moves and analyze your rivals! You can play this card game with only a few players but also with many!
223770.name: Startups

223772.name: Water: The deckbuilding water-cycle game
223772.description:
Water is an introductory deckbuilder based on the water cycle. Game play is symbol based to enable younger children and language independent play.

In Water, players build their deck by purchasing cards from the river using rain and snow tokens. The game ends when all the snow tokens are removed from the cloud, so strategy of when to buy and when to collect comes into play. Other deckbuilding mechanisms such as getting rid of weaker cards help new players lean the basics of this mechanic.

Thematically, cards can move rain or snow between the cloud, a player's reservoir, and other players' reservoirs. Cards can also change the state of the water from gas in the cloud to liquid or solid in the reservoirs.

223773.name: Demolish
223773.description:
With a mixture of skill and luck, players will build up their own map of landmarks while trying to stop others from doing the same.

On your turn you will aim to build new landmarks by playing landmark cards, while demolishing other people's landmarks by playing attack cards. Jules the tourist visits each landmark in turn. If you succeed in demolishing an opponent's landmark while Jules is visiting it, that player is eliminated.

To win a player must either build a winning number of landmarks, or eliminate all other players.

223774.name: Sword Breaker (Issue No. 2 - The Hollow Fingers)
223774.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sword Breaker is a digital fanzine for Dungeon World. Each issue will contain content centered around a particular setting. You can use it like one big dungeon starter or a collection of monsters, items, moves, hirelings, compendium classes and such to drop into other games.

Issue two is a sword and sorcery adventure through a towering verticle city. Shout-outs to Robert E Howard, Fritz Leiber, Michael Moorcock and even Edgar Rice Burroughs. Climb out of the Pits, visit the fabulous Market, fight your way to the top where a dark beyonder known as the Centipede God needs to be killed.

223775.name: East India Companies
223775.description:
East India Companies is a competitive deck-builder where you take control of your shipping empire. Your fleet of white-winged sailing ships are the collateral you utilize to develop and build your strategy, ensuring your victory against your merchant competitors. Maritime portraitures of the 17th through 19th centuries give this deck builder a historic feel, and allow for a more intuitive notion of card/effect as play progresses.

Playing in similar fashion to Dominion, each player begins the game with a starter deck of ships (currency) and waterfront property (victory points). Leveraging their Fleet cards, players determine the best cards and combos from 15 stacks of 25 available with which to best build up victory points until such time as one of several end game scenarios are triggered. After a medium learning curve, a four player game should progress over the course of about 75 minutes. Some game mechanics do allow for player vs. player attacks, but will depend on what stacks the randomizer brings onto the table.

The goal of the game is to have the most waterfront property and Trade Routes in your deck once the final round is played. Any player may trigger the end game condition, but may want to consider what their opponents have been doing over the course of the game.

223776.name: Random Encounter: Seas of the Sea Chicken
223776.description: Random Encounter is a strategic, number-based, pixel-art card game for all ages. Players build encounters made up of various creatures, then try to win as many battles as possible at the table in the pursuit of loot! Each fully customizable deck is made up of basic number creature cards along with several trick creature cards to throw your opponents off guard. Two or more players compete to reach five loot before other players by either winning the most battles or stealing loot from the coffers of their fallen enemies.

223777.name: Planet of the Apes
223777.description: Planet of the Apes is a cooperative game based on the movie of the same name.

223778.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Showdown
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
223778.description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Showdown is a game based on the TMNT comics that features Bebop and Rocksteady.

223779.description:
For a long time now, Earth hasn't been a perfect place to live. You are one of the architects sent to Mars. Your objective is to set up an infrastructure for the first colonists who would arrive on the red planet and start a new chapter for mankind.

Pocket Mars is a fast paced and wildly dynamic card game but don't let the short playthrough time fool you. It's a heavy weight filler! A compressed and easy to understand
set of rules, combined with cards that you can play in more than one way is what makes this game great! Fifteen minutes is all it takes for you and your friends to set out on an exciting adventure in space!

In the world of big games about Mars everybody should have one that fits in their pocket.

Your goal is to place as many colonists as you can in the buildings of your Mars settlement. To do so, you will need to choose carefully how and when to play your cards.

The way you trigger actions on your cards is the heart of the game. Everything depends on where you play them from, which is the game's main strategic element. You could play a project card straight from your hand and trigger its effect instantly or turn it into a module and play it from your preparation zone. This will let you add it to one of the five buildings in your settlement, trigger an action sequence and transport your colonists to Mars – a sure way to put a spanner in the works of your competition.
Each card's set of various actions combined with the buildings' unique properties leaves you with a number of small but substantial decisions:

− Where to put your card.
− Where to play your card from.
− What action sequence will give you the most possibilities within a given turn.

What's more, anyone can activate an action from a module placed in one of the buildings by another player and share its effects.

Pocket Mars may be a small game but Michał Jagodziński sure stuffed it with a lot of options that will have an impact on the survival of our civilization! :)
223779.name: Pocket Mars

223780.name: Freedom of the Forest
223780.description:
An entertaining board game that familiarises you with the Royal Forest of Dean in Gloucestershire and acts like a guide book telling you about the area. It will help you find your way around and enhances your further visits.
