Each player chooses an empty town on the map along with a marker of the appropriate colour. Each player receives 15 cards appropriate to their starting town and must make their way around the map visiting attractions and avoiding diversions.

223782.description:
Sailing across the ocean from another land, the Dynasty Invasion brings two full new Clans, who will count on their own Seven Lucky Gods and introduce an extra Set of Season cards! This expansion brings a lot of extra variety to Rising Sun, featuring two Clans that forego the allegiance of Japanese Monsters, relying on their own Seven Lucky Gods instead.

The Dynasty Invasion expansion box contains:

27 Miniatures
1 Moon Clan Daimyo
3 Moon Clan Shinto
3 Moon Clan Bushi A
3 Moon Clan Bushi B
1 Sun Clan Daimyo
3 Sun Clan Shinto
3 Sun Clan Bushi A
3 Sun Clan Bushi B
7 Lucky Gods
4 Plastic Clan Markers
2 Clan Screens
1 Political/War Tile
8 Stronghold Tokens
15 Season Cards
7 Lucky God Monster Cards
20 Counter Bases
223782.name: Rising Sun: Dynasty Invasion

223783.name: Tiles
223783.description:
User Summary

Tiles is a unique action puzzle game that will both convolute your mind and burn your finger tips!

223784.name: Hotel Anatolia
223784.description:
User Summary

Horror RPG style game by Elven Workshop.

223785.name: Comit the Astrodian
223785.description:
Platformer based on a 22 year old blueprint. Help Comit boost his was through several planets in an attempt to stop the evil space pirate Krater from taking over the Star System

Source: The Developer Website.

223786.name: Comit the Astrodian 2
223786.description:
Comit the Astrodian is the sequel to 2016's Comit the Astrodian. It features new stages, new abilities and new enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

223787.name: Osy Osmosis
223787.description:
Osy Osmosis is a fun game for all ages where you must help Osy stay safe as she navigates through her world collecting stars. Add and remove Osy’s bits (solutes) to control the flow of water into and out of Osy.

Source: The Game Website.

223788.description:
It's the 1940s, and Nazi spies have infiltrated three cities in Chile. Department D.50 of the police is charged with uncovering their evil plans.

One player in this asymmetrical game is the Nazi spy and has to enhance bases in Chile's three major cities, gain control over resources and protect their bases from the investigations of the D.50. The others are the investigators and also have to collect resources, but also 20 evidence points. With these, they can manage to shut down the Nazi bases to win the game.

The game is based on historical events and has been sponsored by the Fondo Nacional para el Desarrollo Cultural y las Artes (National foundation for Cultural Development and the Arts).
223788.name: D.50: Las Redes del Reich

223789.name: d30 Challenge June 2015
223789.description:
From the introduction:

A compilation of entries from the June 2015 d30 Challenge, originally posted as Rended Press.

User summary:

The d30 Challenge was to create a d30-related entry for each of the 30 days in June, 2015.

223790.name: Neon Knights: 2086
223790.description:
Do you have what it takes to become part of the Neon Knights?
Join the XRL (Extreme Racing League) Tournament today!

In the dystopian future of 2086, the city is split in two.
The upper class obviously lives in the upper half of the city while the lower class live in the lower slums.
Cash is illegal in the lower part of the city and the people there now use casino chips from the old world as currency. The upper class business men have created the Extreme Racing League as an automotive racing sport for entertainment. Anyone with a car who lives in the slums can enter, the prize? you guessed it, a pass to enter the city above, crowned as a Neon Knight (Drivers for V.I.P). What you do when you get there is up to you... and another story in itself.

You've spent all your chips on building the car and entering the league. Now it's time to prove your worth in a racing tournament that can only be won by taking risks, and pushing it to the limit. Do you have what it takes, to join the Neon Knights?



Neon Knights is a Career driven racing game for 2 to 6 players. You can play single races or campaign mode which allows you to level up your car and skills as you play the game.

You will advance in your career by buying upgrades and installing weapons and shields on your car. You will also gain fans and sponsorships who will train you in getting the skills you need to become a better driver. During the race you will need to pass over certain street areas to Activate weapons and shield you have on your car, which you can then use on other drivers.

You can go as fast as you want but some areas of the slums are harder to drive trough and will damage you car if you're going too fast. Will you take those risks? Find out, in Neon Knights!

223791.name: Receding Goblins & Gremlins
223791.description:
From the introduction:

An unsuitable sandboxy encounter not really designed for a party of 3rd–5th level Murder Hoboes clobbered together from a mish-mash of Old School RPG retro-clone rulesets (it kinda made sense at the time...)

YOU BRING THE PARTY, WE BRING THE SLIGHTLY UNBALANCED BUT STILL KIND OF HILARIOUSLY INSPIRED GONZO™

223792.name: Snake Pass
223792.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





SSSOMETHING SSSLITHERY
THIS WAY COMES
Welcome to Snake Pass; a physical action-puzzle game that sees the player slither, curl and climb their way through increasingly challenging worlds filled with evermore intricate obstacles and fiendishly mind-bending objectivesSource: The Game Website.

223793.name: Rites of Cthulhu
223793.description:
"The most merciful thing in the world, I think, is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents."

-H.P. Lovecraft

The entirety of mankind hefts no consequence, for our world is merely a borrowed rock. Long before ancient life, as indicated by human evidence, winked into existence, the Great Old Ones walked our landmasses, lived in our oceans, and hung in our skies. But most of them eventually left Earth and fell into a death-like sleep. These horrors of the universe render us no more significant than the insects that we crush under our boots as a matter of living.

Rites of Cthulhu offers a new dimension to traditional card play. Players who like face card games like hearts will love this Lovecraftian twist on standard gaming. Players compete against each other as rival cultists in a series of 6 rites (mini games) to win artifacts. Each artifact adds new interest to the game by introducing a new rule that effects play. After playing all 6 mini-games, the player with the most points from artifact cards wins and becomes the grand cultist.

223794.name: carry. a game about war. revised edition
223794.description:
From Publisher's Website

About The Game

carry is a game focused on the experience of being a soldier in the Vietnam war. Heavily inspired by the films Platoon and Full Metal Jacket and the novel The Things They Carried, carry is designed to provide a serious roleplaying experience in the tradition of these sources.

Revised Edition

The revised edition is an extensively re-organized and re-written text, keeping the core of the original game but revising some of the mechanics to keep focus on the experience of play. With more explication, examples and resources to aid play, this edition reflects 10 years of experience with the game since initial release.

Game Features

- Set cast of characters, customized by a collaborative system of creating the Burdens they bring with them into war.
- No-prep, designed to play out fully in 1-2 sessions of 3-4 hours.
- Unified dynamic die pool mechanic that address issues of trust, dissension and loyalty.
- Can be played in more realistic or cinematic styles based on the groups preference - it doesn't have to be heartbreaking!
More Information

How soldiers behave in war is a difficult topic, and the game focuses more on dealing with that difficulty than on celebrating violence or exploring tactical and strategic choices. The way that players have described a session is “fun, but in the way watching a really serious drama is fun, not fun like popcorn and beer fun.”

carry is structured in a short-form style. It generally plays out from start to finish in one three-to-four hour session. Over the course of the game, characters deal (or fail to deal) with their Burdens and the pressures and difficulties coming from the other characters, and from the GM. At the end of the game, everyone has a chance to talk about both what happens to their characters in the end, and how these characters are remembered in the aftermath of the events of the game.

223795.name: Wizard Revisited
223795.description:
From the introduction:

At 2nd level, a wizard gains the Arcane Tradition feature. Here are two playtest options for that feature: Theurgy and War Magic.

223796.name: Like Clay
223796.description:
User Summary

Like Clay is a story driven adventure game with horror elements.

223797.name: Snowflake's Chance
223797.description:
A scurrying, scampering side-scroller. Run, dodge and hide from a menagerie of hand drawn nasties in this brutal indie platformer. You have 99 chances to escape The Pit. There is no hope.

Source: The Developer Website.

223798.name: Light Apprentice
223798.description:
The Comic GameBook in which you make choices and fight/spare your foes in turn-based challenges. Help Nate and his friends on their journey to revitalize the Planet!

Source: The Game Website.

223799.name: WARTILE
223799.description:
In WARTILE miniature figures battle it out in a real time strategy video game. Position your figurines, use their strengths and be mindful of their weaknesses, activate their special abilities and play your action cards to gain the upper hand on the playing field.

Source: The Game Website.

223800.name: Barclay: The Marrowdale Murder
223800.description:
User Summary

Join detective Barclay in finding his way in a web of plots, intrigue and ultimately in catching William Marrowdale's killer.

223801.name: The Tenth Line
223801.description:
A console-style RPG featuring a colorful cast of characters, unique battle and level-up systems, quick 2D platforming action, and an original, fantastical story about friendship, faith, and finding your place in the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

223802.name: Ultimate Survival
223802.description:
The only aim in Dead Inside is to survive, hunt or be hunted.

Source: The Game Website.

223803.name: Harnly's Hole
223803.description:
From the introduction:

Recommended for 4 - 5 low-level characters (zero to first level) with a least 1 cleric in the party.

Fort Harnly wasn’t much of a fort. It wasn’t anything more than just a glorified one-room guardhouse in the middle of nowhere. In fact, it was so far away from the Baron Walthamthorp’s stronghold that he tended to forget about it and eventually stopped posting guards to the fort. After many years, Fort Harnly fell into disrepair and nearly faded into memory.

223804.name: An Adventure for Every Monster - Bugbear
223804.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure takes place in a mountainous area that has a chasm running through it and several gullies that split the rocky wilderness.

The complex on the map is currently occupied by a gang of bugbears who have kidnapped a merchant’s daughter and are holding her for ransom.

The local lord, having heard of the plight of the girl, has hired the party to take the ransom to the bugbears and escort the girl back to her family.

As well as this, there is a second gang of bugbears who were driven out of their lair by the hostage-takers and want to get it back. They will attack more or less as the party enters the lair to deliver the ransom and take custody of the girl.

User summary:

This brief scenario originally was published as a blog post and subsequently converted to a PDF.

223805.name: d20 Table of Weird Drafts
223805.description:
From the introduction:

What can I tell you about the Wrinkled Tit? It’s in a sleazy section of town. Not close enough to the whore houses to be interesting, and not far enough from the shadowy Foreign Temple district for comfort. Only the hardcore losers, snuff-peddlers, and out-of-work roughs come here—which is how they like it. The Teat (as it is often called) is owned by Fultch Blestow, slum-lord extraordinaire and general social parasite. Its list of barkeeps is sordid and lengthy, going back several hundred years and featuring an astonishing number of miscreants, blackmail artists, and petty dealers in contraband. What’s even more surprising is the array of intoxicants on tap.

User summary:

A d20 random table of strange drinks, including bottle labels!

223806.name: You Don't Know Where That Monster's Been!
223806.description:
From the introduction:

Your dungeon is too clean. Maybe it’s not your fault. After all, those gnomes on the second level are pretty OCD. They must spend several hours per day picking parasites off the hides of their pet bugbears and giant rat‐steeds. And then there’s that gelatinous cube on level four—sliding its bulk through the corridors and dissolving every little tidbit of septic Filth in its path. But despite the efforts of your clean‐freak gnomes and acidic jellos, the general state of the average dungeon should be just... appalling. I mean, can you imagine how obscene the stench rolling off your run‐of‐the‐mill lizard‐man must be? Something like a wet bag of poo collected from a Newfoundland who ate too much leftover Indian food. Yes. That bad. You can’t tell me that one of those guys isn’t ground‐zero for some sort of unspeakable crotch‐malady.

It just seems that—Gygaxo-naturally speaking, of course—the environment of the dungeon and especially the creatures within it would be carrying all sorts of creeping crud. Disfiguring diseases, skin conditions, noxious butt parasites, eye‐warts, etc., etc. Sure, there’s rot grubs—one of my Top 5 favorite classic monsters, by the way—but they’re just the tip of the old iceberg. Or they should be anyway.

User summary:

Includes the excellent "D20/D30 Table of Dungeon-Funk".

223807.name: Paranoid Fantasy
223807.description:
From the introduction:

Paranoia is something I really strive to get from the players while DMing. When they’re paranoid, you know that their involvement in the game has passed from the purely abstract to a kind of belief in the drama that’s unfolding. Players are left a little unnerved or worried in a pleasantly omniscient sort of way. It’s similar to the experience of reading an especially effective piece of horror lit. They never approach the level of terror that could induce an actual panic attack. Not that I want to inflict that experience on anyone necessarily, but what if that degree of paranoia befell the character? What sort of bizarre behavior might result? And how would paranoia — as a game element and system — affect play overall?

223808.name: Crypts & Critters
223808.description:
User summary:

The game uses several unusual components, including Playmobil Knights (or at least miniatures), a set of large foam polyhedral dice, and a set of specialty dice (several types are enumerated as options). A pack of specialty cards can also be incorporated.

Play involves using lots of dice and miniatures. The intriguing and amusing rules are somewhat... flexible.

223809.name: doc's SIMPLE RPG
223809.description:
From the game:

You have 10 character points to work with. Divvy them up as you choose and put them into your MIND, BODY, and SPIRIT circles. These are your primary stats, used for offense.
...
You’ll always roll two six-sided dice (2d6) vs. your own stats.

User summary:

This four-page document includes a one-page introduction, the one-page game, and two one-page adventures: An Out-Of-This-World Aliens Scenario and A Mythical, Monstrous, Egyptian Scenario.

223810.name: Everyone's Grumpy Under That Hill... and a River Runs Through It
rpgseries: Swords & Dorkery Iron Chef Adventure Challenge
223810.description:
A Gonzo Monty Haul Railroad Scenario

From the introduction:

The river goes into the mountain. That’s never good. There’s rumors in the village about ten miles upstream about what’s in there — strange sounds, minor earthquakes, boulders that pick themselves off the ground, weird things, stuff of nightmares, etcetera, etcetera, but the locals would rather stay the hell away because hey, what you don’t know won’t kill you, right?

223811.description:
Players take turns manipulating the field of monsters and focusing their mystical power to “enlist” creatures to form the strongest army possible.

The goal is to control the strongest force of monsters from the Realm, which is made up of cards indicating the monster that occupies that space and its power level.

Players take turns peeking at the cards to determine where the most powerful monsters are hiding, deviously moving the monsters around, and strategically placing their Mage Cards around the borders of the Realm. Once all the Mage Cards are in place, players compare the power value of the magical energies that intersects at each monster. The player with the higher total mystical power value gains control of that monster (usually). The player who collects the most powerful set of monsters wins.
223811.name: Archmage Origins

rpgseries: Swords & Dorkery Iron Chef Adventure Challenge
223812.name: Madness in the Mist
223812.description:
From the introduction:

Inside the temple called The Pearl Of Sea And Sky, an elemental rift has loosed mistgoblins on the solid world. Unless they are driven back, the temple and the town and all around will dissolve into mist, mist, endless mist...

rpgseries: Swords & Dorkery Iron Chef Adventure Challenge
223813.name: Rivals for the Time Domain
223813.description:
From the introduction:

It all started in the Hylbu Valley, where an old man became a god. He had spent such time becoming one with nature and leaving behind his earthly cares that he had magnificent powers over spirits and animals alike. Those who lived in peace with nature in the valley saw his god-like powers and worshiped him as their local protector. He was called Ricky Tick-Tock. His high priest traditionally gave up his or her name, the better to become one with the land. As Tick-Tock‟s followers protected the land, the land protected them, and their harmony deepened.

rpgseries: Swords & Dorkery Iron Chef Adventure Challenge
223814.name: Members of Caven
223814.description:
From the introduction:

Caven was a powerful wizard of ancient times, excelling at necromancy and divination. Among the secrets that Caven craved was how to achieve godhood beyond this life. He is said to have become a demi-god at least before passing into the service of the God of Undeath as his/her advisor. What better dwelling than where all knowledge goes eventually?

223817.name: Neon Prism
223817.description:
User Summary

Space ship puzzler from Just1337

223818.name: Charlie's Adventure
223818.description:
User Summary

Cartoonish zombie slaying platformer. Avoid the traps and defeat the zombies.

223819.name: Cube Runner (2016)
223819.description:
User Summary

3D cube platformer by Just1337

223820.name: Slash It
223820.description:
User Summary

3D action arcade puzzler by Just1337

223822.name: Fantasy Chesslords
223822.description:
Fantasy Chesslords / 棋幻爭霸

Fantasy Chesslords is a fantasy themed strategy game that combines the gameplay experience of Chess with Customizable Card Battle.

Two players taking turn playing cards and moving pieces until a player wins, either by destroying the opposing LORD, or moving your LORD onto the opponent's PORTAL STONE.

223823.name: ONMYOJI: Spirit War
223823.description:
ONMYOJI: Spirit War / 陰陽百鬼譚

"Onmyoji: Spirit War" is a battle of wits card game with legends of Japanese exorcists and yokai(demons) as theme. You play as an Onmyoji, controlling 2 of the 5 elements and use it to summon "Shikigami" spirits as your ally. Use your courage and wits to break opponent's Magic Circle, and become the best Onmyoji in the history!


Contains English/Japanese/Chinese rulebook & player aid

223825.description:
Here is the football match Poland v Germany. Quite small size but has very high rank! The table becomes a stadium, cards—turf and players—team.

Piłka w grze is a simple pattern recognition game combined with very simple soccer match simulation. The game consists of deck of large cards with images associated with football and wooden ball token. Five of these cards laid on a table produce small board—football pitch—combined of five spaces.

The aim of the game is to score three goals. In order to score a goal the player have to move the ball to the utmost space in front of his or her opponent and win the decisive duel.

To move a ball or win a duel players compete, one trying to identify pairs of common symbols faster than their adversary. Ball may be moved from its space to adjacent one only if a player recognizes and names the only image, which these two spaces have in common. Before each move new card is played on board, putting new symbols in play.

Whoever scores third goal, wins the game. Teams may also determine that the game lasts until one team reaches a different, mutually agreed outcome or score more goals in the allotted time.
223825.name: Piłka w grze

223827.name: Cry Monster!
223827.description:
You and your monster friends are worried as the villagers have finally had enough of all of your shenanigans and are hunting you all down one by one. It's every monster for themselves in this game of deduction, deception and survival.

In Cry Monster! each player is a classic monster like Frankenstein's monster, The Invisible Man or Dracula. Each round the villagers put up a reward poster for one unlucky monster. Your job is to pierce the disguises of your fellow monsters and determine who is who. Once you know, you have to decide if you throw them to the villagers or help them by deceiving everyone into thinking it's one of the other monsters. Of course, if you are the wanted monster it's time to pull off your greatest act of deception. You have to work fast because the pitchfork and torch crowd is growing quickly and starting to Cry Monster!

223828.name: Legends of Callasia
223828.description:
Legends of Callasia is an original world conquest strategy game inspired by Civilization, Heroes of Might and Magic, and Risk. It has an original simultaneous gameplay mechanic where players can plan and resolve their turns all at the same time. Easy to pick up and learn, the game has a classic tabletop feel, allowing players to build and control heroes and armies, build castles and cities, and control territories and kingdoms. It allows for thrilling games with up to 8 players that are playable in just a couple hours.

Source: The Developer Website.

223829.name: Legends of Callasia - The Stoneborne
223829.description:
User Summary

First expansions of the game Legends of Callasia. The expansion includes:

An All New 10-Level Single-Player Campaign
11 Playable Stoneborne Heroes
Improved Stoneborne Units, including new Artillery
New Hero Trait: Sapper
New Enemy Faction: the Cavespawn
20 New Maps for Skirmish and Multiplayer
Underground Seasons: Sprout, Spore, and Wilt
Over 20 New Cards such as Dwarf Fury, Blizzard, Territorial Oppression, and more!
New Player Emblems
New Achievements

223830.name: Good Little Ninjas
223830.description:
The game takes place over one week in a bustling Japanese village. Each day, you will employ Farmers, Carpenters, Peasants and Merchants to harvest rice and construct buildings.

The more daring might send Ninjas to raid the Palace Treasury, or recruit Samurai to prevent the predicted raids. You might even persuade one of the more powerful inhabitants to help you: the Shogun, the Daiymo, or even the Emperor himself!

Ultimately, the player who best uses their cunning to gain the most coins wins the game.

Good Little Ninjas is a card-drafting game for 2-4 players, aged 12+ that takes about 30 minutes to play. It is available as a free print-and-play download from the Good Little Games website.

223831.name: Le Terre Nascoste
223831.description:
From the back of the book:
L'assenza di luce non implica necessariamente l'assenza di vita. Perché se è vero che più forte è la luce più lunga sarà l'ombra che ne verrà proiettata, è altrettanto vero che nell'oscurità più profonda si celano i tesori più brillanti.

English translation:
The absence of light does not necessarily imply the absence of life. Because if it is true that the stronger the light the longer the shadow that will be projected, it is also true that the deepest darkness conceals the brightest treasures.

223832.name: SHENZEN Solitaire
223832.description:
User Summary

Classic solitaire game by Zachtronics Industries

223833.name: Duke of Alpha Centauri
223833.description:
User Summary

Space shoot em' up with amazing graphics. Destroy endless waves of enemies.

223834.name: Slash It 2
223834.description:
User Summary

2D colorful arcade puzzler. The goal is to press letters, numbers and type words in the right time and direction.

223837.name: Slash It 2 - Chinese Edition Pack
223837.description:
User Summary

Third DLC for game.

- Includes 6 new game modes including "Chinese Mode" where the words are displayed in Chinese instead of English.
- 6 new songs:
AuX - Stardust
Elexive - Sheriff
Erio - Monolith
Hinkik - Explorers
Mike Chino - Calm and Harmony
NaiKee - Sunder

223838.name: Flow: Tales of Odea
223838.description:
Flow is a 2-4 player card game set in the fantasy world of Flow.

Goal: Get the highest score by the end of the game. In case of a tie, last player wins.

End Game : Number of the decks equal to the number of players runs out. e.g. 2 players = 2 empty decks, 4 players = 4 empty decks.

Gameplay: Every round, players do 3 available actions in any order they choose.
A - Activate card abilities
B - Buy
C - Card Draw

223839.name: Avventure nel Magnamund
223839.description:
User summary:
Italian boxes set including the modules "Adventures of the Kai" and "Heroes of Magnamund"

223840.name: FAITH: Core Book
223840.description:
From publisher blurb:

FAITH is a roleplaying game in a sci-fi setting, where starfaring alien civilizations race to explore a dangerous, unknown universe.

The FAITH setting is one of valiant space travelers, remote uncharted stars and bizarre alien technology. But it’s also a realm of mysterious, invisible forces – the Gods and the outlandish, supernatural powers they grant to those mortals who believe in them.

In FAITH, you can be a star explorer, a soldier, a scoundrel or a mystic believer, using a mix of technology, training and god-given powers to survive the untamed regions of wild space against rival factions, alien perils and ruthless bandits.

FAITH's gameplay is card based (using a poker deck based system). This is no gimmick: it's a fully developed and thoroughly tested mechanic where players start each scene with a hand of cards to affect the outcome of every confrontation. The system offers room for nuance and strategy, and players can explore different angles to find the one that better fits their play style.

223841.name: The End of Known Space
223841.description:
From publisher blurb:

At the edge of the universe: a strange and alien world?

A thousand unsolved mysteries: but who will find the answers.

The End of Known Space is a collection of science fantasy monsters for Dungeon World (and Adventures on Dungeon Planet!), drawn from the Monthly Monsters patreon project. This book includes over two dozen monsters, two alien planets, an asteroid mining station, and the numerous plots and schemes they are all involved in, from psychic Illuminati to infectious space madness.

Whether you came for the drugs or the political corruption, to hunt alien creatures on safari or use this world as a launching point for expeditions to Zeta Centauri, the secrets of Planet Maldoran will change your life forever.

223842.name: 60+ Mutant Human Characters
223842.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Labyrinth Lord/Mutant Future AD&D/Gamma World free retro-clone. For use with Mutants and Mazes cross-over. Over 60+ Mutant Human characters complete with ALL statistics and modifiers, Constitution modified Hitpoints and Dexterity adjusted Armor. Replete with FULL weapons and equipment with Encumbrance automatically collated and applied to movement rate. Also with character name and personal history. OVER THIRTY PAGES OF PLAYER CHARACTERS WITH FULL MUTATIONS AND DRAWBACKS RANDOMLY GENERATED AND PROVIDED WITH STATISTICS. Characters for 5 x each level for levels 1-12 AND MORE!!!. Also compatible with AD&D/Gamma World.

223843.name: Cepheus Engine Vehicle Design System
223843.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cepheus Engine Vehicle Design System provides comprehensive rules for developing non-space vehicles for the Cepheus Engine or any Classic Era Science Fiction 2D6-Based Open Gaming System. Inspired by the starship design system found in the Cepheus Engine SRD, this vehicle design system provides everything you need to create vehicles from the most primitive levels of technology to the most advanced. In addition to the complete Vehicle Design System, you can also find for twenty different vehicles to serve as examples: all-terrain vehicles (ATVs), armored fighting vehicles (AFVs), G/carriers, air/rafts, biplanes, grav bikes, grav floaters, grav tanks, ground cars, helicopters, hovercraft, motor boats, naval destroyers, speeders, stagecoaches, steamships, submersibles, tunnel boring machines, twin engine jets, and even white panel vans.

With the Cepheus Engine Vehicle Design System, players and Referees alike can now create vehicles for their own science fiction universes or the ones they are already familiar with!

223844.name: Arcane Quarter
223844.description:
From publisher blurb:

10 locations in the arcane district of a city - Includes 10 detailed locations, shops, 30 adventure hooks, and three novelties.

Each product has Further Adventure™ hooks to aid in writing follow up quests, and an exclusive spell, monster, item, god, or optional rule that is previously unpublished.

223845.name: Book of Heroic Races: Player Races 2
223845.description:
From publisher blurb:

Extraordinary Races

Go beyond the standard fantasy races and play a new breed of hero. These intrepid adventurers forge their place in legends with splinter, gill, electron, and scale. Now you can play one of these heroic races in your home game and battle monsters like never before.

Book of Heroic Races: Player Races 2 introduces a number of playable races for your fifth edition game. This 13-page supplement gives you everything you need to include the following races at your table:

Androids, machines with human-like souls, including subraces powered by alchemy and technology
Geppettoians, a halfling-sized, wooden construct race possessing free will to forge their own paths
Gillfolk, a race mutated by powerful sea monsters to serve as slaves who have won their freedom, featuring two subraces defined by where they live in the sea: the shore-line gillfolk and their deep-sea cousins
Lizardfolk, scaly swamp-dwelling heroes whose subraces originate from draconic progenitors or stewards of nature

223846.name: Personas: The Colonel
223846.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get down with the crazy chicken!

The Colonel is a new Extra for your Skum of the Stars game. An insane mercenary commander and veteran of the imperial army, the Colonel is ready to be a terrifying foe or crazed yet stalwart ally of the Crew or individual characters – introduced into any campaign by the Game Master or player characters alike. First of our Personas series for Skum of the Stars, the Colonel features:

Full profile for the Colonel and others.
Ideas for linking social Talents to the character.
A guide for using Infamy with the Colonel.
A short piece of introductory fiction.

223847.name: The Drift of Trees: Adventure
223847.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bitter War

A mysterious treasure, a disarmed robot god, barbaric war. When the Crew enter the Drift of Trees, the barbaric biosphere offers more trouble than expected. Side with King Caden and rule the Drift, or aid Yegdral in liberating it, the choice rests in the hands of the players.

The Drift of Trees Adventure is a detailed narrative for Skum of the Stars games that can be used in a stand-alone format or combined with the Micro-setting for a broader experience.

223848.name: The Drift of Trees: Micro-Setting
223848.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Savage Sphere

A spherical series of trees, linked by vines and intertwined branches, and orbiting the star of Nemus, the Drift of Trees is a world of barbarians. Enter this strange biosphere of subterranean woodlands where a good Blaster is worth more than gold and a Skumbag can make their mark in savage conflict.

The Drift of Trees Micro-setting is a detailed location for Skum of the Stars games, containing an overview of the Drift of Trees along with both its key and generic inhabitants.

223849.name: Vradprol: Micro-Setting
223849.description:
From publisher blurb:

Engines Roaring

Vradprol: An endless city stretching into the sky, below the surface and across every square inch of the planet. Ruled by the dystopian Chemical Guild at the top and assaulted from below by the Rocket Gangs, this is a city that is ready to tear itself apart. Get your Crew ready for violence as they step onto the streets of Vradprol.

The Vradprol Micro-setting is a detailed location for Skum of the Stars games, containing a keystone overview of the planet, along with detailed tables for generating specific regions and inhabitants.

223850.name: Vradprol: Adventure
223850.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ambrosia of the Gods

The Chem-Master, a mysterious figure, rocket races and the Ambrosia of the Gods at last. It might have begun on the Vermillion Sword but it’s going to end down below, on the dark streets of Vradprol. The Chemical Guild want it. The Zero Ghosts don’t want anyone to get it. But in the end, it’s the Crew who will decide who gets the Ambrosia of the Gods.

The Vradprol Adventure is a detailed narrative for Skum of the Stars games that can be used in a stand-alone format or combined with the Micro-setting for a broader experience.

223851.name: Fortunate Sons: The Anonymous Battle, March 26 1971
223851.description:
The NVA laid a clever trap for their nemesis, the 1st Air Cavalry Division, in the remote northern region of Tay Ninh Province, not far from the border with Cambodia. Charlie Company of the 8th Regiment, 1st Air Cavalry was dispatched to inspect suspicious activity by the NVA north of Fire Base Illingworth. On March 26th they were ambushed by the 1st Battalion of the NVA's 272 Regiment, 9th Infantry Division. Deep in jungle terrain, Charlie Company was cut-off and unable to call-in accurate artillery or air support. The jungle canopy also made impossible any extraction by helicopter. It looked like the Communists were about to wipe-out or capture over 100 US soldiers.

Four kilometers away was Alpha troop of the 11th Armored Cavalry, along with Alpha Company of the 8th Regiment of the 1st Air Cav. Commander John Poindexter, monitoring the increasingly desperate radio messages from Charlie Company wasted no time in ordering his men to "Saddle Up!" in order to rescue their trapped comrades. Busting through jungle and risking ambush, the rescue and battle fought here in March, 1970 rank among the war's most epic and amazing fights.

Fortunate Sons is the companion “sister” game to Bad Moon Rising: The Battle for Firebase Illingworth. The two games use the same design and scale. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate units and resolve some game events, as well as a six-sided die.

223852.name: Bit City
223852.description:
Build your own Bit City! Start from a tiny town and grow to a thriving metropolis in this city building idle game from the creators of Tiny Tower. Collect profits and invest in upgrades that keep your city growing. Fill your city with new types of cars, planes and ships. Unlock cool new buildings, including famous landmarks to customize the look of your city. What are you waiting for?

Source: The Developer Website.

223853.name: Hitting the Bottle Week
223853.description:
From the introduction:

There really aren’t a lot of magic containers in D&D outside of those that hold genies or an endless supply of dihydrogen monoxide. So here are twelve magic bottles, flasks, boxes, bags, and other containers to use in your games.

User summary:

This item was originally published as a blog post, and subsequently converted to a downloadable PDF document.

223854.name: Old School Heretic's What's Inside the Mysterious Tome d30 Table
223854.description:
User summary:

A d30 random table enumerating concepts found in old books. Some include (minor) magical effects.

223855.name: Sentient
223855.description:
Description from the publisher:

The next great technological revolution is here. Sentient robots for information, transportation, industry — all at our fingertips. Building them is now the easy part. Programming them has proven to be more complicated. A handful of companies have emerged claiming to pull it off, but only one will win out. Your mission is clear: Procure valuable bots and plug them into your network. They'll have an effect on your systems. Anticipate it correctly, program your bots effectively, and attract the right investors to win and lead the sentient revolution.

In Sentient, players are tasked with choosing from available robots to program in their factory. Each robot that is added modifies your board and attracts the interest of investors for your company. Program your bots efficiently and collect the support of your patrons to build the most formidable operation.

223856.name: Stuff You Might Find at the Goblin Market
223856.description:
From the introduction:

Goblins are not known for being especially intelligent in the musty, wizardy-sense of the term. However, they are crafty and can be quite shrewd. Every once in a while, when the conditions are just right, they get together to hawk their wares. While there is a certain degree of goblin-to-goblin trade occurring at such markets, these events are in the main intended for outsiders. A goblin market will spring up in a location that is far from the eyes of the Man, as goblins tend to deal in items that are generally considered unsavory, dangerous, or too cryptic to be entirely trusted. The typical customer is one who is not averse to the magical, one who is seeking something outside the scope of what is offered in the stalls of the town’s commons.

223857.description:
Saloon Tycoon: The Ranch Expansion expands your Saloon Tycoon experience by adding a new ranch board for each player. Each turn, you earn a ranch point to be spent on developing your ranch. You can acquire horses and cow meeples, new tiles for your ranch board like the bunkhouse, new animal pens, and new rooms for your ranch home!

New ways to score that supplement building out your saloon add a new dynamic to the game without being needlessly complicated.
223857.name: Saloon Tycoon: The Ranch Expansion

223858.name: Kittys
223858.description:
Kitties is an easy-to-play card game. Players will be cats and cats will meet with cats. I am aiming for a better feed station that I can have in a good food, but it is hard if I try to go to a better feed station than Bosnaeko. Let's find a good food so as not to be disturbed by Bosnaeko.

Playing time: 5 to 30 minutes
Number of players: 3 to 6
Game design: Emiusuke
Illustration: Orie

set content
12 color cards × 6 players
Boss marker
Six points chip (1 point, 2 point, -1 point) 6 pieces each
Score list

We will deal 1 to 12 cards to all players.
The player substitutes "Bosneko" instead.
Players will release one card at a time, but only cards with smaller numbers than the cards issued by their parents will score.
Bosneko players score all cards they give out, but if they are cards with the same number as the cards they got, only their children score and they can not score.

"At a cat meeting I can not go to a better feed station than a boss. However, if the child's cat wants to go to the same feeding station as the boss, the mother-boss cat will give the bait to the child. "

223859.name: GKR: Heavy Hitters Urban Wasteland Expansion
223859.description:
Transform your GKR: Heavy Hitters gameboard into an urban wasteland with a set of durable plastic buildings and decorations! The add-on pack includes:
- x10 city buildings with caps
- x12 sentry guns with rules for use during the game
- x4 corporation toppers
- x3 building spires
- x80 translucent holo-board tags
- Sticker sheet to decorate!

223860.description: Deck out your Heavy Hitters & Support Units! Corporate Sponsorship never looked so good. x2 A4 sheets of decals to apply to your GKR: Heavy Hitters miniatures (Heavy Hitters, support units, mercenary units, or Big Little Buddy add-on.)
boardgameaccessory: GKR: Heavy Hitters
223860.name: GKR: Heavy Hitters – Waterslide Decals

223861.name: High Ranger Guard
223861.description:
User summary:

High Ranger Guard describes the defending force of an elven forest. Players "join" the Guard with their role play characters and use the rules, table, and other role play materials in this adventure module to patrol and defend the forest against numerous threats.

The title is long out of print and hard to find.

223862.name: GKR: Heavy Hitters Big Little Buddy
223862.description:
Big Little Buddy, a friend you can share! Need a friend? Call on the corporation with money to spend! Enter BUDDYFINDER™ - the premier subscription-based friend rental service. Rental friends starting as low as 12.99 a month!

In sport, there are usually a couple of big sponsors that pay for exclusive primary advertising and presence. In GKR: Heavy Hitters, Big Little Buddy is that guy. He’s made available for the match (as well as serviced and repaired after the match) by his premier sponsor – BUDDYFINDER ™. They’ve got money to burn and they want their name everywhere. IN YOUR FACE.

Subtle, Little Buddy is not.

When Big Little Buddy is deployed to the gameboard, he advertises for whichever Faction has unlocked him for that round. Players can try to claim Little Buddy by playing a special Sponsor Card – a move that can only be deflected by playing a counter-hack.

Once a player controls Lil Buddy, the fun begins. Move him during the Movement Phase, and use him to attack opponents in the Combat Phase with his own unique cards: 3 Weapon Cards and 1 Unit Card. Each round, he can only fire 1 of these weapons in his arsenal BUT he does not require Energy to fire. Making him really rather handy in a pinch. Once the Combat Phase is over, players lose control of him once more.

Like all Units, Little Buddy can be destroyed. Once he’s destroyed, he’s removed from the game completely. Buh bye, Little Buddy.

One important note: Lil Buddy is not considered a “Support Unit” so he’s not bound by Support Unit rules. That also means he can’t tag buildings. Standing at 70mm he’s a mid-size Unit that, we think you’ll find, more than pulls his own weight.

With Little Buddy, you’re not just getting an awesome new mini, 1 unique Unit Card, 5 new Sponsor Cards, and 3 new Weapon Cards. You’re getting a little friend to keep you warm through those long lonely nights.

223863.name: World of Silverdawn
223863.description:
User summary:

World of Silverdawn was a campaign setting on a full continent. It included a full color map (22" x 17"), and descriptions of all major locations and points of interest, as well as residents with whom the characters could interact in various ways.

It is now out of print and hard to find.

boardgameintegration: The Walking Dead: All Out War
The Walking Dead: All Out War
223864.description:
The Prelude to Woodbury is a narrative single-player adventure featuring Brian ‘The Governor’ Blake and his exploits from before he rose to power in Woodbury and encountered Rick. The introductory quick-start tutorial will take you through the rules step-by-step as you play out the Governor’s story, and the box contains everything you need to get right into the action. You do not need the All Out War core set to play, but all of the Prelude to Woodbury components are all fully compatible with the core set, so you can use Brian and his equipment in your larger, two-player games.

This set contains 6 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Brian ‘The Governor’ Blake to your games, along with 5 Walkers to battle your way through. It also contains an exclusive ‘Solo’ version of the game’s Event deck.
223864.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War - Prelude to Woodbury Solo Starter Set

223865.name: Society of Sorcery
223865.description:
User summary:

Society of Sorcery described a magic system and a guild of mages for use as a component in a heroic fantasy role playing platform.

Included were various branches of the Society, their goals, rules of the Society, and other information upon which to build character interactions and adventures.

It is now out of print and hard to find.

223866.name: Peddler's Ferry
223866.description:
User summary:

Peddler's Ferry was a village game setting for heroic fantasy role playing games.

This adventure module had a map of the town, and details about residents, vendors, and services. It also described adventures which could be found in and around the town, and quests of longer durations that a role play group could undertake for residents of the town.

223867.description: 32 faction-themed colored defense dice; 8 per faction, plus a Hapsi can dice container. Replaces the basic non-themed dice that come with the base game.
boardgameaccessory: GKR: Heavy Hitters
223867.name: GKR: Heavy Hitters – Faction-Themed Defense Dice

223868.name: Mikeeze Wurld Monsters
223868.description:
User summary:

This collection of monsters is derived from a variety of sources which, generally, are unattributed. Most entries in the compilation originally were published as blog posts and subsequently gathered into the PDF document. All entries follow a standard statistics block format, with associated text in game-standard format. Many entries have an illustration.

The monsters are enumerated in alphabetical order. The document does not have front matter or an index.

223869.name: Color Slap!
223869.description:
Color Slap Card Game

The Slap the Splat card game!

Slap your way to victory in this test of color coordination and fast reflexes.

Players take turns placing cards face up in a pile.
Whenever a card showing a splat with matching text is flipped, players must race to Slap the Splat and win the pile!

Easy right? Things get crazy with splat cards with no text and splat cards with non matching text.

Whoever gets the most cards wins!

223870.name: Carcassonne: Bogatyr' na rasput'ye & Izbushka
223870.description:
Каркассон: Богатырь на распутье & Избушка (Bogatyr' na rasput'ye & Izbushka)is a little expansion (2 tiles) for Carcassonne, made by the Russian editor of the Carcassonne game (Hobby World) and was a present for the participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league 2013.

One tile represents Bogatyr' na rasput'ye "Hero at the Crossroads" from a russian folktale.
The second tile represents Izbushka, the small hut from Baba Yaga the witch, also from a russian folktale.

1. Bogatyr' na rasput'ye
no special rule for this tile.

A possible translation if the text on the stone on the tile is:

If you go to the left - you'll find death.
If you go to the right - you'll lose your horse.
If you go straight - you'll live, but will forget who you are [or forget yourself].

2. Izbushka
This tile scores as an anti-cloisters:
One point for the tile and one point for each tile missing around the tile, for a maximum of 8 points.

223871.name: Dungeon Scum
223871.description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the Starport Scum scifi rules, Dungeon Scum is a narrative wargame intended to be played by role players and war gamers alike.
Gather your group of adventurers, set out on a dungeon delve and hope you make it back!
Get loot, see the sights, maybe go on an epic quest.

Dungeon Scum sets itself apart in a few ways:

The combat rules are fast, simple and easy to remember, allowing you to fight multiple encounters in one gaming session.
Unlike many RPG's, it includes a morale system for more realistic combats.
It can be played solo, with encounter tables and monster lists for a fully random delve.
It can be turned into a full-fledged role playing game.
Characters can generated randomly in a few rolls or simply described with a couple of common-sense sentences.




Your hero is a SWORDFIGHTER with QUICK REFLEXES and a VOW OF SILENCE? Good, that's all we needed to know.

Loot is well supplied with tons of magical items to find.
6 types of magic with 10 spells in each system, plus "quest" spells used in campaign play.
Campaign rules for letting your heroes become stronger..if they don't die.
While the game is intended to use miniature figures, advice is provided to players who prefer playing without them.

223872.description: Void Pirates presents a Sci-Fi skirmish miniature battle game using a streamlined version of the Goalsystem rules. Use whatever miniatures you own to play out exciting skirmishes in any future world! Build crews with as few as two miniatures, or as many as seven. These rules work in any scale between 10mm - 54mm, and offer flexible and fun character creation, furious combats, and rewarding campaign play. Gather your friends, a handful of six-sided dice, and your favorite miniatures, and blast-off for Sci-Fi fun!
223872.name: Void Pirates

223874.name: Astra - New Occult Class
223874.description:
From publisher blurb:

Using the mind as a weapon is usually just an expression, but the astra makes it possible, using her innate psychic power to channel energies from the Astral Plane into a magical weapon. The astra is a powerful and exotic warrior who can never be separated from her weapon. She creates a weapon using mantras and by making an emotional link with her blade. The blade it’s not just materialized energy; while tapping into the Astral Plane in her mantras, the astra can get a glimpse of a deity’s weapon or even form a link with a lost soul. The astra’s own feelings and emotions form this link when she invokes a mantra.

CLASSiffieds: Astra brings you a new Occult Class that excels at battle, using psychic weapons to defeat her enemies.

Create powerful energy melee weapons using the power of your mind!
Channel your psychic energy to protect yourself with powerful armor effects.
Customize your energy blades with personalized Mantras. Acid, Fire, Balance, Chaos and more are at your fingertips.
The Hundred Arms. Need a hand? Grow one for battle with this new archetype!
The Phoenix Soldier! Bond with the legendary phoenix and take your prowess to the next level with this archetype!
Extra Mantra, Improved Astral Step, and Unbound Astra feats enhance your Astra

223878.description:
A print and play expansion for T.I.M.E Stories.

Salvage Series: The Agency is facing budget cuts. You need to complete a series of covert missions to salvage the resources necessary to keep the operation running.

Easy Street Mission: Getting the largest pile of gold in history makes sense, but why is it in a small town suburb in 1952...?
223878.name: Easy Street (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)

223879.name: Ictus
223879.description:
Wage War in the Steampunk Apocalypse
The world has changed. Over a hundred years have passed after the American War for Independence was interrupted by the opening of the first rift and the Legion of Damned poured though. Humanity was facing extinction at the hands of the demonic and undead. Finally the Angelics arrived and set a stop to the expansion of the rifts and halted the free roaming Legion hordes. Once on the brink of extinction humanity has surged back, forging new countries and technologies. Now after decades of rebuilding the uneasy peace is starting to fracture. Skirmishes are becoming more frequent along the borders and nations turn to warmongering.
Titan Zero Industries LLC presents Ictus, a table top wargame set in the Stempunk apocalypse of 1909. Ictus features high quality miniatures, six unique factions, an all-new stacking rule set and multiple game scenarios including cooperative play.
In standard Skirmish or competitive game scenarios the goal is to eliminate the other player(s) officers. However, in cooperative play scenarios the goals of the game can vary to include eliminating the enemy, surviving for a number of rounds or achieving a set goal.
Each unit is a paintable miniature that comes with a corresponding card that details the abilities of that character. While many abilities are set, conflict is resolved by the rolling of six sided dice (D6), with rolls of 5’s and 6’s being considered successful. Stacking is the major game mechanic. The Shield Warden unit, for example, provides a +1 defensive bonus to all allies within 1”. If there are three Shield Wardens within 1” of each other the bonuses stack and each unit would receive a +3 defensive bonus.
There are six different factions to choose from; the British American Colonies, Mercenaries, United American Territories, Legion of Damned, Republic of Cascadia and Empire of Castile. Each faction has a unique look and play style.

223880.name: Garimpeiro
223880.description:
"El Dorado discovered in Estado de Para!"

With the discovery of a large gold deposit, Brazil erupted into a frenzied gold rush. Over ten thousand workers swarmed to become garimpeiro (gold prospectors in Portuguese) and make their millions. The greed filled desires of the garimpeiro and their patrons bored deep holes into the earth like an inverted pyramid, and the once lush jungles were quickly stripped naked, giving the name of Serra Pelada to the dig site - "the Naked Mountain".

In Garimpeiro, each player becomes a patron of the garimpeiro (gold prospectors) who will lead them to seek fame and gold ore through various actions, in order to become the greatest man or woman in Serra Pelada. It is a full-fledged worker placement game that simulates the excitement of gold prospecting.

223881.name: Batman Miniature Game: Arkham Knight Campaign
223881.description:
Arkham Knight is the first campaign supplement for the Batman Miniature Game. This 132-page, full-colour book is the ultimate toolbox for devising, organizing and running your own campaigns with your friends, transforming your games from one-off encounters to a series of linked adventures, where every result counts towards ultimate victory or crushing defeat.


What is a Campaign?

At its most basic, a campaign is simply a series of linked battles between two or more players. The result of each game has an effect on the next, giving the winner an advantage in the later stages of the campaign. Inside the Arkham Knight Campaign book, you’ll find rules and guidelines for creating and running campaigns – taking your one-shot games and instead playing a series of linked scenarios, with ultimate victory coming to the crew that achieves its long-term goals. Everything from organizing a campaign to forming alliances or playing multiplayer games is covered, making this your one-stop source of campaign material.


Not only that, but within these pages you will find a complete, ready-to-run narrative campaign, recreating the Arkham Knight saga from the thrilling finale of Rocksteady’s Arkham trilogy, and giving you the chance to save or destroy Gotham City. Want to see what would happen if the Arkham Knight defeated Batman? Or if the Scarecrow became the most powerful crime-lord in Gotham? Now’s your chance! Every scenario in the campaign also comes with suggestions for alternative participants – so even if you don’t have the right models to play the Arkham Knight storyline, you can still play the campaign with the models in your collection. You can even use the scenarios as standalone ones if you want to, adding even more variety to your games!


Is it Just About Campaigns, Then?

Not quite. While much of the book is geared towards campaign play (as you’d expect), you’ll also find some awesome new rules that you can use in your regular games. Want to play a Predator Mode game, where a single hero stealthily takes down a mob of Henchmen? Now you can. Want to play four, five, or six-player games? We got you covered. Want character cards for a whole host of vehicles, including Batmobile variants, GCPD vans and Rattler Drones? Look no further.

Oh, and if you still needed an incentive to order this tome, there’s a chance to get your hands on a limited edition Arkham Knight model, with three different head variants, while stocks last.


“Tonight Ends with Gotham’s Fall….”

223886.name: 2d24 Table of Pit Trap Surprises
223886.description:
User summary:

This brief document presents a random table containing unusual features for pit traps; for example "The pit trap is 10 feet deep and filled near to the brim with rat bones."

223887.name: Old School Heretic's Motivational Dysfunctions
223887.description:
From the introduction:

They’re nothing but a bunch of rag-tag ruffians, drifters, and cast-offs from the dregs of society who’ve been conscripted and sent off on a suicide mission for some megalomaniacal despot who disavows all knowledge of their very existence. The group is its own worst enemy. In-party squabbling wrecks everything—feuds, grudges, even outright contracts to ‘dispose’ of each other. But why? Because everyone is motivated by something and everyone is dysfunctional as hell.

223888.name: Tombstone: Role-Playing in the Wild West
rpg: Tombstone: Role-Playing in the Wild West
223888.description:
From the introduction:

Tombstone is set in North America from 1865 onwards. The American Civil War is over. The nation has been traumatised and scarred by war, but somehow life goes on. Society has changed, and new possibilities emerge. Railroads need building, the West needs taming, and gold needs mining. The transcontinental railroad is slowly being constructed, creeping across the continent from the East and West coasts. It finally meets near Salt Lake City, Utah. Mormon country.

223889.name: iDC - improvised Dungeon Crawl
223889.description:
User summary:

This game straddles the line between roleplaying game and board game. Characters do have race, class, and various traits but most of them are determined randomly during setup. Characters do have options and make decisions, but they are limited primarily to tactical decisions within an extended dungeon crawl.

The game uses a stripped pack of French playing cards and a standard set of polyhedral dice. The game master role is performed by card draws and a rotating player.

The game supports up to four players and, intriguingly, can be played solitaire if desired.

223890.name: Crisis Meeting One: The HUETEOTL Projekt
rpg: Crisis Meeting One: The HUETEOTL Projekt
223890.description:
From the introduction:

A real-time in-character chamber drama for five players and one referee.

User summary:

This game is distributed in six PDF files:


One 22-page game rules and scenario
Five 5-page character documents


Note that all of the characters and much of the rules documents are intended for print-and-play use.

223891.name: Turing's Asylum
223891.description:
From the introduction:

The Asylum was made to create AIs that could pass the Turing test. It isn’t an AI itself, but it had to be clever enough to test them and learn from them. It also had to keep them from escaping the cortex. It decided to remove any knowledge of the outside world. Humanity is a distant memory.

User summary:

The game is provided in two PDF formats - a standard ("pocket mod") version on one page and a "linear" version of separate pages. An ePUB version also is available.

223892.name: Jeopardy! Card Game
223892.description:
The Card Game version of Jeopardy! TV Show.

Players test their wits answering real questions from 20 categories from the TV Show.

6 categories are randomly dealt to the board to determine what categories are in play this turn. Then players are dealt a hand of 6 category cards - these determine what questions the players can answer.

Each question is worth $100 times the number of questions asked in that category this round.

In Double Jeopardy, cash amounts are doubled.

For Final Jeopardy, players set how much of their winnings they wish to wager based on a single chosen category.

The Player with most money at the end of the game wins!

Advanced rules introduce drafting of both Category and Category Cards for more strategic play.

From the back of the box:
No Alex? No Problem!

Simply grab the Jeopardy! Card Game and get ready to play.

1000+ clues from 20 different categories will challenge all players from novice to expert.

Just remember to put your response in the form of a question!

223893.name: Scath: Shadow of the Fomori
223893.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Scath: Shadow of the Fomori, a dark fantasy RPG heavily inspired by Celtic mythology! Welcome to a dark world where alien powers rule and humanity cowers behind flimsy walls. But there is still hope...

In this game you will take control of a Chosen One, a human whose body has merged with the powers of one of eight ancient elemental spirits. These beings have given you power. They have given you magic. But soon you will realize that such gifts always come with a price...How far are you willing to go to save your people?

This core rulebook includes everything you need to play in the world of Scath.

The first half of the book, the Player's Guide, will explain all the rules of magic, exploration and combat to you and give you information both about the Chosen Ones and the crumbling, desperate human societies they come from.

The second half, the Gamemaster's Guide, includes rules for many terrible monsters and their mystical masters, the Fomori. It also gives you detailed information about the lands of Scath and the legendary characters that live in them. Finally it includes rules for pitched battles, when the Chosen Ones have gathered the forces of humanity behind them and are leading them to one all deciding war against the Fomori.

223894.name: Scath: Shadow of the Fomori Player's Guide
223894.description:
From the introduction:

This core rulebook includes everything you need to play in the world of Scath. This book, the Player's Guide, will explain all the rules of magic, exploration and combat to you and give you information both about the Chosen Ones and the crumbling, desperate human societies they come from.

User summary:

The Player's Guide document is distributed as a free download; it is excerpted from the larger core rules.

223895.name: The Dark Heart
223895.description:
From the introduction:

The Dark Heart is an introductory adventure to the world of Scath and has everything you need to start playing as soon as possible. The basic rules of Scath are explained in a first chapter, including the handling of combat encounters.

The second chapter has the adventure itself, a short scenario for 4-5 characters that will take about four to five hours to finish. It will give both gamemasters and players their first glance into the world of Scath, and what it feels like to be living in it.

The third chapter includes all the important NPCs and adversaries both human and otherwise that the players might have to face in their search for "The Dark Heart".

The fourth chapter finally holds five pregenerated characters, brave heroes to be controlled by the players. Just have your players choose one of these heroes each and you can jump right into the adventure!

The Dark Heart is designed with at least four heroes in mind, but can be played with less than that if the gamemaster makes some small adaptations or takes control of the remaining heroes as NPCs who accompany the player characters on their journey.

223896.name: Egyptian Senet
223896.description:
After performing opening of the mouth ceremony on your mummy, you start your afterlife journey to pass through the underworld realm of Osiris, challenging an invisible adversary inside an Egyptian hidden tomb in The Valley of the Queens located near the better known Valley of the Kings, on the west bank of the Nile river across from Thebes (Luxor).

Senet is a board game from predynastic and ancient Egypt, it is the earliest known record of a backgammon , checkers and chess like games.

Source: The Developer Website.

223897.name: Forts
223897.description:
Forts is a physics-based action-RTS, where players are challenged to construct custom bases and destroy their opponents in a battle for the last of Earth's natural resources. Construct an armored fort while collecting resources. Arm it to the teeth. Develop your technology to unlock advanced weapons, then target weak points in your opponent’s fort. Shoot down incoming missiles and patch up damage before your fort comes crashing down. Defend your reactor at all costs!

- Build forts of any size and shape, as you fight.

- Up to 9 players in online multiplayer with co-op and team death match.

- 28 mission single-player campaign.

- Challenging skirmish mode.

- Unlockable tech-tree.

- Ten unique weapons.

- Three factions.

- Powerful replay system.

- Built-in level editor.

- Designed from the ground up to support mods.

Source: The Developer Website.

223898.name: I Am Not Of Your Element
223898.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 PCs of Levels 13-14

Recently a wave of otherworldly energy flowed down a fault line far into the Underworld, dissipating where a fire giant monastery rested over a lava lake. The giants’ delving through the floor towards the lake had imperceptibly but irrevocably weakened the rock the ironclad stone halls sat on; it collapsed, taking down most structures, and even the stoutest giants finally drowned in the lava. One giant lives - the monastery’s Doombringer.

Severely injured, the interplanar energies inhibited his natural healing. This far underground, the PCs sense the sulfurous heat long before reaching the carnage. They’re on a cliff edge, with lava dozens of feet below. Their route, towards the northeastern corner, should be a path across a cavern floor, but now it’s via a series of flat-topped columns rising from the lake below. Scorched stalagmites are dotted about. Three gigantic buildings are perilously close to the cliff ’s lip.

223899.name: The Sydymic Outworlds Cluster
223899.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sydymic Outworlds are at the very edge of Imperial space. Most trade is internal, but a considerable amount of cross-border dealing goes on (originally mainly at Ked, now moving elsewhere) between Imperial firms and their counterparts in the Khuur League and beyond. The cluster is also important as a link on the Jump-4 route into Gateway sector and thus sees official Imperial vessels passing through its ports and some long-range ships from Gateway Sector going the other way (mainly from the Galian Federation).

223900.name: Deckplans 1: Scout/Courier (Type S)
223900.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scout/Courier (Type S): Details on the ubiquitous Type S Scout, including costs and background, plus 15mm and 25mm deck plans.

223901.name: Fast Courier
223901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fast Courier is a complete supplement for the Traveller role-playing game. Full stats are included for Classic/T20 Traveller, but this rules-light supplement is suitable for use with any version of Traveller, or indeed with other rules sets. This supplement contains several adventure seeds set in the Spinward Marches, which could be used anywhere in the Traveller Universe.

223902.name: Sword Worlds Patrol Cruiser
223902.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement outlines the standard, heavily armoured 600-ton Sword Worlds Patrol Cruiser, with complete stats, deckplans, history, variants and operational details.

This supplement also contains several adventure seeds set in the Spinward Marches. These could be used anywhere in the Traveller Universe.

223903.name: Archaic Small Craft, Launches and Gigs
223903.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement details some of the dozens of small craft that can be encountered in an inhabited system, from Highport launches and gigs to the primitive exploration craft of emerging races. To the high-tech traveller, a trip aboard a rocket-powered deathtrap may be an enlightening experience!

223904.name: Ship's Boats and Pinnaces
223904.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement details more of the small craft that can be encountered in an inhabited system, including variants of the standard ship's boat and both fast and slow pinnaces.

223905.name: Cutters and Shuttles
223905.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement details the ubiquitous shuttles and the most versatile workhorse of the Traveller universe, the modular cutter. With the cutter modules here, you can convert a standard craft for a variety of military, commercial and other roles.

223906.name: Corsair
223906.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 400-ton Bucaneer class corsair has been used for centuries throughout charted space. This supplement presents five corsair bands that operate in the Spinward Marches but can easily be transplanted anywhere. Some corsair bands are new to piracy; others have operated for decades beyond the Navy's reach, deep in non-aligned territory. Each group includes background information and likely encounters.

223907.name: LSP Modular Starship
223907.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement details an entirely new class of ship; a 300 ton "framework" vessel which utilises the versatility cutter modules to create an infinitely customizable vessel. The modular starship can be configured as a cargo hauler, a research vessel, a hospital ship, an escort carrier or whatever else the owners may need. 12 cutter modules are detailed, complete with stats and deckplans for each module, as well as stats for the 600 ton Zhodani patrol corvette and Zhodani 10 ton light fighter, as well as the Imperial 20 ton multi-role fighter, which is carried in one of the cutter modules.

Three adventure seeds are also included.

This is an ideal vessel for characters wanting a versatile starship. Cutter modules are readily available on the open market, making conversion simple and easy.

223908.name: Dragon Fist
223908.description:
From publisher blurb:

Immortal Fighter of the Innocent

Despite being one of the most talented martial artists in the world, Jonathan Rockford was seen as nothing more than a Hollywood B-movie action star. John’s life turned towards the strange when he was invited to compete in a tournament of Immortal Fighters. John was delighted to participate; believing that the prize of "immortality" was meant as fame and glory.

In the end, John faced down the final challenge: the black dragon Xuanlong. With his final punch, he felled the beast and its essence transferred to the victorious fighter.

Unfortunately, the other Immortal Fighters were not finished with the champion. They followed him, seeking his prize, and endangering innocents with their deadly weapons and battles.

To protect mankind from the antics of these Immortal Fighters, Jonathan retreated from the public eye. At night, however, Jonathan adopted the identity of “Dragon Fist: Immortal Fighter of the Innocent.” (PL 9)

When Jonathan’s girlfriend, Porsche Pembrose, helped found White Hats Incorporated, Jonathan supported her as a partner and employee. As Dragon Fist, Jonathan has sworn to use his fighting skills to help others.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

223909.name: Semiramis
223909.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her Name Brings Death

An ancient entity with ancient powers, Semiramis (PL 21) (pronounced "Shamiram”) is survived the Atlantean Wars to eventually become one of the most powerful creatures on Earth. Siphoning the life force of others to sustain her own existence, this being uses her network of devoted mortal worshipers and psychic vampire minions to locate and capture the vitalest of meta children. She waits for them to come into their own powers, then consumes them.

The Shepherd Academy, with all the delicious, young potential hereos, is of particular interest to her insatiable hunger.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

223910.name: Doorways: Old Prototype
223910.description:
User Summary

Doorways: Old Prototype is a game that precedes the story of the Doorways: Prelude Saga. It was originally a prototype game developed in 2011-2012 to show a proof of concept but was later released for play.

223911.name: Doorways: The Underworld
223911.description:
Dark pathways, inhumane torture chambers; frozen, eternal museums of suffering.

Inside each enigmatic maze, agent Thomas Foster follows the trail of scattered victims leading him to the next madman. In that very same paths, he relive their torments in his own flesh and bone, allowing the pain in every scream to reach his senses, dragging him, bit by bit, into a vortex of utter insanity.

But he knows this, alas, this is the toll of a telepath.

And maybe, that toll would be too high for him to bear.
And the Doorways’ player will look through his eyes, as the main witness of his psychic odyssey, unveiling one by one the puzzles and contraptions of his mind, having to face the indescriptible horrors lurking in his ordeal.

Whoever plays Doorways will be corrupted, his mind wretched by the same spiral of madness that would justify Foster twisted motives. A spiral capable of destroying a weak mind.

Source: The Game Website.

223912.name: The Clockwork Laboratory
rpgseries: The Ruined Tower of the Tempest Mage
223912.description:
From the introduction:

Knock, knock, open the door. Tick tock, time is short. Stalk, stalk, it comes for you. How will you open the lock, once you can no longer wind the clock?

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters, brought to you by Cold Iron Conventions and Draxtar Games.

223913.name: The Desolate Undercroft
rpgseries: The Ruined Tower of the Tempest Mage
223913.description:
From the introduction:

The deepest depths of the ruins of the Tempest Mage's tower have not seen a living soul for centuries. In the silent dark, death waits for you. Will you rush to meet him?

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters, brought to you by Cold Iron Conventions and Draxtar Games.

223914.name: Aeon's End: The Void
223914.description:
This expansion will include:

2 Mages
18 Nemesis Cards
7 Nemesis Specific Tokens
2 Nemesis (+1 additional nemesis mat)
50 Player Cards (including randomizers)

223915.name: Blowing Up the Movies
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
223915.description:
From the back cover:

Robin D. Laws, game designer by day, cinema super-enthusiast by night, sets his analytic laser sights on action and thrills in a collection of essays sure to supercharge your tabletop roleplaying experience.

As the countdown ticks and the bullets fly, Robin takes you inside the workings of 24 action movies, from the stone cold classic to the unjustifiably obscure. Each essay shows you how the film delivers, and the lessons you can extract from it to enhance your own efforts as GM or player. Explore:

• Star Wars as a model of storytelling economy.
• Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon to see how fights can express inner drama.
• Seven Samurai as a master class in theme.
• Die Hard as textbook cat-and-mouse.
• The Killer, to learn the blood-soaked vocabulary of blood-soaked hyper-romanticism.
• Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame, because deer fu.

Though honed as a companion volume to the exciting new reboot of his classic RPG Feng Shui, you can easily apply this book’s insights to any game with swords or explosions in it.

With a special focus on high water marks of the Hong Kong action golden age, alongside the flicks that inspired it and were inspired by it, the book also serves up a crash course in that essential action canon.

So dig in, fire up one of these flicks for the first or five millionth time, and be ready to be blown up. Er, away. Blown away.

boardgameimplementation: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies Strategy Battle Game
The Hobbit: the Desolation of Smaug Strategy Battle Game
223916.description:
A companion to the main rules of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey™ Strategy Battle Game, focusing on the second and third instalments of The Hobbit: Motion Picture Trilogy, this is a gorgeously-realised, hardback, full-colour book featuring a plethora of new and revised profiles for use in your games of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey™ Strategy Battle Game. Recreate the events of The Hobbit: The Battle of The Five Armies™ and The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug™!

Featured in the 152-page hardback:


a whopping 25 scenarios continuing those found in The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey™ Strategy Battle Game, following the flow of the movies on which they are based – including the Battle of the Five Armies itself;
66 new and revised profiles giving you the full range of heroes and monsters to use in your games;
a detailed campaign system, linking the scenarios together in a way which follows the flow of the movies;
5 appendix scenarios;
a collection of army lists, helping you to organise your miniatures into a cohesive force for Points Match games.
223916.name: The Hobbit: Motion Picture Trilogy – There and Back Again

223917.name: Chicken Run
223917.description:
Chicken Run is a simple collection game that takes strategy, a little bit of luck, and a whole lot of fun.

Here are the facts: There’s chickens, roosters, and feed. Each player tries to pair four chickens of the same color along with a rooster and feed to complete a Chicken Run.

The game is fast paced– compete against other players to fill your chicken coops and complete your runs- the first to reach ten points wins. But watch out for action cards though as other players can steal or eat your chickens right from your coop.

While Chicken Run is simple, it is full of energy and excitement that develops as players attack one another with varmints, protect their coops from attacks with guard dogs, and trade with other players for the cards they need to complete a Chicken Run.

223918.name: Psychic Warrior II
223918.description:
From publisher blurb:

The psychic warrior blends his martial prowess with his psionic ability. In this release, you will find new options for the Psychic Warrior from Ultimate Psionics for use in the Pathfinder RPG.

Psionics Augmented: Psychic Warrior II is a 10-page PDF that includes:

One new psychic warrior archetypes - the silhouette
